loans.name: Marichelle

texts.en:
Marichelle L.'s main source of income comes from her carenderia (mini restaurant) selling a variety of foods for breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks. She is 28 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the city of Sto. Nino Aguada, Ozamiz City. Marichelle has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Marichelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marichelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase supplies for her carenderia. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her "carenderia"

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 26 years old. She is divorced and has one girl who is in school. She lives with her daughter in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. She works hard to be able to provide for the family. Grace is a trader. She trades in cosmetics. She sells in a shop by the roadside in her community and she treks to sell. Grace buys the cosmetics from nearby towns. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: Zenabu is a 56-year-old married mother of eight children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities. Zenabu is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey, a local food from corn dough. She prepares the food in her house and sells at the local market in her community. Zenabu buys the raw materials from nearby communities. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Cobra

texts.en:
Cobra R. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 53 years old. Cobra is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Cobra owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Cobra has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cobra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cobra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cobra is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cobra from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
La socia LUCIANA pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, es natural de la provincia de Calca, del departamento del Cusco., ubicado a una hora de la provincia de Cusco.
  
La socia tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene cuatro hijos dos mujeres y dos varones, el mayor estudia en el Instituto Superior “Khipu” de la ciudad del Cusco y los hijos menores estudian en el colegio.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención del pequeño negocio de venta frutas al por mayor y menor en el mercado central de ciudad Calca. La fruta lo trae de la quebrada de la ciudad de Quillabamba que esta a doce horas de la ciudad del Cusco.  

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas como papayas, plátanos, naranjas mandarinas, mangos, piñas etc.    

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luciana belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Asunta." She is from the Calca province of the Cusco region, located one hour from the province of Cusco. She is 44 years old, a single mother, and has four children: two girls and two boys. The older children study in the Instituto Superior "Khipu" college in the city of Cusco, and the younger children are in school. She alternates her activities in the home with a small business selling fruit wholesale and retail in the central market in the city of Calca. She brings the fruit through a narrow pass from the city of Quillabamba, which is 2 hours from the city of Cusco. She needs a loan to increase her inventory of fruits such as: papayas, bananas, mandarin oranges, mangos, pineapples, etc. Luciana is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and pledges to make her payments according to the established timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital for her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Favor

texts.en: Favor is married with three children. Her eldest child is 12 years old and the youngest child is six years old. She is 34 years old. Her husband is a pastor.  She sells groceries and drinks in Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for a loan of 60,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe R. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old. Phoebe is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Phoebe owns & operates a kitchenette, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Phoebe has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Phoebe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Phoebe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Phoebe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Phoebe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: Zenabu is a 54-year-old married mother of four children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities. Zenabu is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge. She prepares the porridge in her house and sells by the roadside in the morning in her community. Zenabu buys the raw materials from nearby communities. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo en su casa propia. Diariamente labora como jornalero en las chacras de sus vecinas, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta 5 de la tarde. Su labor es quitar las malezas para limpiar las chacras y se tenga un buen desarrollo de los cultivos. Trabajando de este modo  se siente satisfecho, por serle provechoso, ya que toma acuerdos de terminar una determinada extensión en 15 días, y al trabajar con su esposa lo termina en 9 ó 10 días y el resto de tiempo lo dedica a sus cultivos de café, para de ese modo no descuidar sus cosechas.
A Elmer le gustan sus labores agrícolas, aunque a veces el proceso del café es largo y dificultoso, pero es la forma como obtiene mejores ganancias.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde ratifica su compromiso de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, así como de seguir cumpliendo su función de secretario de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y 500 plantitas de café.
texts.en:
Elmer is 29 years-old and lives with his partner, the mother of his child, in their own house. Everyday Elmer works as a day laborer on the farms of his neighbors, from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. His job is to remove the weeds and thus clean the fields, allowing for a good development of the crops. Working in this manner is satisfying and profitable, as Elmer makes agreements to finish a certain amount of land in 15 days, and then finishes the agreed amount with his wife in only 9 or 10 days. He then spends the extra time working on his coffee crop, thus he is able to take care of his own harvest. Elmer likes farm labor, although sometimes the process of cultivating the coffee is long and difficult, but that is his way of earning more money. This is Elmer's second loan with MFP, where he has agreed to make all the payments on time and to continue working as the secretary for his communal bank. He plans to invest the loan funds in the purchase of fertilizers and 500 coffee plant seedlings.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and coffee plants

loans.name: Promesa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Promesa que pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch, se agruparon recientemente por la necesidad de contar con mayor capital que les permita ampliar sus negocios, liderizadas por su mesa directiva, así Benira María G. es la Presidenta,  Rosa Q. es la Secretaria de Actas y Miriam C. ocupa el cargo de Tesorera y esperan estar juntas por mucho tiempo hasta lograr ahorros considerables.
Las integrantes de este grupo tienen variados negocios como la  atención de tienda de barrio,  venta de comida,  venta de ropa,  tejido de mantas, costura de prendas de vestir, venta de pintura para cuero y venta de cerveza.
Todas necesitan del  préstamo para comprar materia prima y mercadería y seguir  mejorando sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Promesa (Promise) group is a member of the German Busch communal bank. They came together recently because they needed more capital to enlarge their businesses. They are led by their governing board which is presided by Benira María G., Rosa Quintero is recording secretary and Miriam C. is treasurer. They hope to stay together for a long time until they have managed to amass substantial savings. The group members have a variety of lines of work like: neighborhood general store, prepared food sales, clothing sales, blanket weaving, dressmaking, leather paint sales, and beer sales. They all need the financing to buy raw materials and merchandise in order to continue to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and merchandise.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel es un joven soltero de 27 años, vive en la casa de su hermana. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y debido a que es un joven muy tímido su hermana le pidió que la ayudara en la atención de su tienda para que pueda perder esa timidez.
Desde entonces Fidel ha ido ganando varios amigos, como los de su banco comunal, pero él está convencido que el comercio no es para él, pues sus sueños son de tener cultivos de café y piña.
Por tal motivo ha empezado a sembrar en sociedad con su hermana, en las chacras de sus padres, ella pone la semillas y Fidel es el encargado de trabajar con las plantas, ya que se siente muy feliz con esa actividad.

Él ingresó a su banco comunal por invitación de su hermana, y ahora que ya es su segundo crédito está tomando solo sus decisiones, por lo que hace el compromiso de seguir pagando puntualmente sus cuotas, como en su crédito anterior. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mil plantitas de café.
texts.en:
Fidel is a single, 27-year-old young man who lives in his sister's house, and has worked his whole life in the agriculture business. Because he is such a shy young man, Fidel's sister asked him to help serve customers in her store, so he might lose some of his shyness. Since then, Fidel has made a few friends, like the other members of his communal bank, but he is convinced that the retail business is not for him. His dream is to grow crops of coffee and pineapple. For this reason, he has begun to plant with his sister on their parents' fields: she plants the seeds and Fidel is in charge of taking care of them, as he enjoys this activity very much. Fidel joined his communal bank through an invitation from his sister, but now that this is his second loan he is making all the decisions himself, and has again promised to make all payments on time, like he promised with the previous loan. The funds from this loan Fidel plans to invest in the purchase of one thousand small coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee plants.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 46-year-old married mother of five children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities. Elizabeth is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. She prepares the food in her house and sells in a kiosk by the roadside in her community. Elizabeth buys the raw materials from nearby communities. She has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Heraclides

texts.es:
Heraclides tiene 52 años, está separado de la madre de sus 5 hijos, pero ellos viven con él en su casa. 

Aunque el amor no le ha sonreído para toda la vida cuenta con la gratitud y el cariño de sus hijos, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo, pues por ello trabaja con mucha responsabilidad en cada una de las contratas de macheteo o  limpieza de chacras que realiza. Así, se ha ganado la confianza de la gente de su pueblo, pues siempre le dan trabajo y con estas ganancias logra alimentar y educar a sus hijos.
Pero Heraclides también tiene sus propios cultivos de café y plátanos, a las que se dedica cuando no trabaja como operario. Él se siente muy feliz de labrar la tierra, gracias a esta habilidad ha podido dinamizar su economía, y ahora que han crecido sus hijos piensa  incrementar sus cultivos de café con la ayuda de ellos.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y vienen ratificando su compromiso de seguir trabajando como hasta ahora, responsablemente, con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, pues quiere seguir contando con préstamos posteriores. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de platitas de café y fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Heraclides is 52 years-old and is separated from the mother of his 5 children, though they live with him in his house. Though love has not smiled on Heraclides for his whole life, he always has the gratitude and affection of his children, who are the reason for his efforts. For them Heraclides works very responsibly on every machete-clearing contract and field cleaning job he gets. By doing so, he has earned the trust of the townspeople, and now they always give him work. With these earnings he succeeds in providing food and education for his children. Heraclides also has his own coffee and plantain crops, which he works on when he has no other work. He likes working the land a lot, and thanks to his skill he has been able to increase his earnings. Now that his children are grown up, he plans to expand his crops of coffee with their help. This is Heraclides' second loan with MFP, and he promises to continue responsibly working as he has in the past, by making the payments on time, especially since he would like to receive more loans in the future. The funds from this loan will be used to purchase small coffee plants and chemical fertilizers for the fields.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and coffee plants

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a 33-year-old divorced mother of five children who are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities. Vida is a trader. She trades in plantain. She supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also treks to supply. Vida buys the plantain from nearby communities. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy plantain in bulk

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
Hermenegilda tiene 39 años, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos, con los que vive en su casa.
Ella trabaja diariamente en sus chacras de plátanos y café, desde las 10 de la mañana hasta 6 de la tarde, en compañía de su esposo. Pero en algunas oportunidades trabaja sola en la chacra de sus vecinos, y es más difícil porque lleva a su bebé cargado en la espalda, pese a ello tiene que trabajar para obtener ganancias adicionales mientras espera la cosecha de sus cultivos de café.
Por tal motivo, Hermenegilda planeando empezar a sembrar plátanos y de ese modo no depender sólo de la temporada del café; sino que podrá alternar sus ingresos, pues como toda madre quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos para cuando lleguen a la edad para empezar sus estudios.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y no ha tenido ningún problema de pago anteriormente, más por lo contario ha demostrado ser una presidenta (de la junta directiva de su banco comunal) muy responsable. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mil plantitas de plátanos.
texts.en:
Hermenegilda is 39 years old, is married and is the mother of three children who all live at home. She works daily in the fields of bananas and coffee from 10 in the morning to 6 at night alongside her husband. But at some times she works alone in her neighbors' fields and it is harder because she carries her baby on her back. She has to work to gain extra income while she waits on her coffee harvest. For this reason, Hermenegilda plans to begin planting bananas so that she won't be dependent on the coffee season. She will be able to supplement her income and as a mother she wants to improve her children's quality of life by the time they get to the age when they will begin their studies. This is her second loan with MFP and she has not had any problems with payments in the past. On the contrary, she has acted as a responsable president of the leadership of the Village Bank.She will use the loan to purchase one thousand small banana plants.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of banana plants

loans.name: Edy Orlando

texts.en:
Edy is 34 years old and lives with his common-law wife and their four-year-old daughter.  Edy and his wife are dairy cow farmers and currently have four dairy cows for milk production.  Edy sells the milk to Pil, a large local dairy company in Cochabamba.  Pil then uses the raw milk to produce all sorts of milk products, including yogurt and cheese.  Edy has been farming since he was a little boy, helping his mother on the family farm.  His family currently lives in Edy's childhood home.

Edy's mother recently got sick and because she had to continue working, she strained her body more and more. Sadly, about a year ago Edy's mother passed away, which has left him to care for his 17-year-old brother.  Edy also works as a taxi driver, but now that he needs to take care of his brother, the earnings from that job haven't been sufficient for his family's needs.  

Edy will use this loan from CIDRE to purchase another dairy cow.  This will increase his milk production, which he hopes will grow his earnings so that he can improve his family's quality of life.  Edy has many dreams, including owning his own taxi, paying his brother's school fees, and remodeling their family home.  Also, Edy and his wife are proudly expecting another little one on the way, and they are very happy they have this loan to help grow their income for their new baby.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta C. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 46 years old. Crisanta is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Crisanta owns & operates a business making & selling banana cue. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Kareem

texts.es:
Kareem es un joven soltero de 20 años, vive en la casa de sus padres.
Hace algunos años atrás sembró los plátanos en las chacras de sus padres, ya que tiene pensado estudiar una carrera técnica en la localidad y para ello sabe que tiene que buscar una fuente de ingresos, y qué mejor dedicándose a la siembra de plátanos. 
Su idea es estudiar de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana dedicarse a tiempo completo a sus cultivos, él está seguro de concretizar sus sueños, ya que tiene el apoyo de su madre para los gastos de su alimentación.
Dedicarse a sus cultivos lo llena de enorme alegría y más aun sabiendo que gracias a sus siembras va poder forjarse una carrera, pues desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su madre y hermanos menores.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde viene haciendo un compromiso de pagar sus cuotas en las fechas señaladas, porque quiere contar son posteriores préstamos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Kareem is a single young man who is 20 years old and lives in his parents' house. A few years back, he planted bananas in his parents' fields as he was planning on studying for a technical carreer nearby and to do so he needed a source of income and nothing could be better than a banana crop. His plan is to study from Monday to Friday and on the weekends work in the fields. He is sure he can achieve his goals since his mother helps with food expenses. Working in the fields fills him with enormous happiness as he knows that the harvest will help him get ahead with his education and he would like to help his mother and younger siblings have a better quality of life. This is his second loan with MFP and he has been timely in his payments because he wants to be able to take out future loans. He will use the loan to buy chemical fertilizer to improve the soil in his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Fertilizer

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua trades in game meat. She is a 29-year-old married mother of two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community dominated by farming in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Akua buys smoked game meat from nearby communities and sells at the local market. Akua says she also supplies food vendors in her community. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy game meat

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo.
Su cultivo preferido es el café, ya que este producto le brinda granos de primera y en grandes cantidades. De enero a marzo trabaja de forma constante quitando los arbustos que se apoderan rápidamente de sus chacras de cafetales. En mayo se prepara para la recolección de los granos de café con una canasta amarrada a la cintura, con la ayuda de su esposa y demás familiares, ya que la cosecha se debe realizar lo más rápido posible, porque de no ser así, se caen los granos al piso y eso complica el trabajo. Terminada la recolección, el lavado y el secado del café, acude a las acopiadoras de su localidad, a quienes vende su producto y muy contento regresa a su casa, donde comparte las ganancias con su familia.  

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y la más plantitas de café.
texts.en:
Miguel is 31 years old and he lives with his partner, the mother of his little boy.

His favorite harvest is coffee, this being the harvest that provides the best yields and in great quantities. From January to March he works constantly to remove any weeds that might quickly take over his coffee plantation. In May he gets ready to do the harvest of coffee beans, usually with a basket tied to his waist. With the help of his wife and other family members he must complete a harvest as quickly as possible because the beans will fall to the ground otherwise, complicating matters. Once the harvest is done he must wash and dry the coffee he goes to the sellers in the neighborhood to sell hsi product. He is free to go back home at this point with the revenues for his family.

This is his second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he has dedicated himself to paying it back on time. The funds that he requests will be investedin the purchase of chemical fertilizers, as well as coffee plant seedlings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and coffee plant seedlings.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa es una mujer muy carismática, tiene 29 años, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos.
Desde pequeña se dedicó a la siembra de café y plátanos, es por ello que realizar estas labores no le parece nada difícil. Hace 5 años atrás, junto a su esposo, han sembrado sus primeras chacras de café, a las cuales le han dedicado todo su tiempo y trabajo con el anhelo de forjarse una economía más estable, pero lamentablemente su primera siega no les dio buenos granos de café como esperaban. Ahora Ninfa está pensando fertilizar sus chacras con nitratos y de ese modo su próxima cosecha sea mucho mejor, pues a ella le gusta su trabajo y está muy segura que mediante sus cafetales su economía vaya ir mejorando.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y hace el compromiso de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas como en el primer ciclo, pues está muy contenta de contar con el crédito. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cafetales.
texts.en:
Ninfa is a very charismatic woman; she is 29 years old, married, and is a mother of 3 children. Since she was little, she has dedicated herself to the sowing of coffee and bananas, and for that reason these labors don’t seem too difficult. 5 years ago, together with her husband, she planted their first coffee fields to which they dedicate all of their time and they work with the eagerness of forging a more stable economic state for the family. Unfortunately, their first harvest did not yield good coffee beans like they had hoped for. Now Ninfa is thinking of fertilizing her fields with nitrate and in this manner her next harvest will be much better. She likes her work and is very sure that through her coffee plantations her economic state will improve. This is her second credit with MFP, and she has pledged to punctually pay her share as in her first cycle. She is very happy to count on this credit. The money that she now requests is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her coffee plantation.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana runs a provision store in her community. She is a 54-year-old widowed mother of seven children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Nana buys her goods from big supermarket stores in nearby towns. She has been in business for over 30 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Juliaca

texts.es:
Juliana es mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, tiene 30 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.

Hace 10 años sembró sus plantas de café y plátanos en sus propias chacras y ahora se está dedicando a quitar las malas hierbas y la maleza que crece alrededor de sus cultivos. Estos trabajos las realiza con mucho esmero y cariño, pues generalmente trabaja con su esposo, y para las cosechas sus hijos también se suman a la recolección, pues solo trabajando de esta forma logran recolectar varios quintales en un día, lo cual le es muy beneficioso para ellos.
Una vez preparada la carga la transportan en carro (dos horas de camino) hasta la ciudad para venderlas a las acopiadoras. Con estas ganancias, Juliana y su familia tienen una economía estable, por ello sus anhelos son de de incrementar este cultivo (café) y mejorar su calidad de vida.  

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, donde muestra mucha gratitud, ya que para ella estos créditos son de gran utilidad, por lo que no piensa defraudar la confianza. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Juliana is a simple, hard-working woman. She is 30 years-old, married, and has two children, and lives with her family in their own house. Ten years ago Juliana first planted her crops of coffee and plantains on her own fields, and now she is working to remove the weeds and bad plant growth that are growing around her lands. Juliana does these tasks gladly and with lots of care, as she usually works alongside her husband and her children also help out with the harvest. Just working this way the family can harvest several quintals a day, which is very beneficial for them. Once the load is prepared, it is transported in car (two hours traveling) to the city to sell it to the collection plants. With these earnings, Juliana and her family have a stable income. Juliana wishes to increase their crops of coffee and improve their quality of life. This is Juliana's second loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the opportunity, as these loans are of great use to her, and would never betray the institution's trust. The funds from this loan will be invested in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for the coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice sells sarongs and tailoring materials at retail prices. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She is 33 years old and married with four children. With her combined businesses, she sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes for a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs and tailoring material to sell. 
She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is 37 years old. She is married and has five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Dora is a trader. She trades in jewels. She sells in a shop by the roadside in her community and she treks to sell. Dora buys the jewels from nearby towns. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy jewels

loans.name: G.s. Reyna.- Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Reyna tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, por lo que no ha sido su primer crédito, por lo que ambos han aprovechado al máximo para la inversión de su negocio. Reyna se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas, por lo que hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es un medio de subsistencia para ella y sus hijos. Con la ayuda de Don Luis lograron unirse para realizar un financiamiento y proporcionarles a sus negocios capitales de trabajo que son necesarios para salir adelante. Los dos tienen todas las mismas fuerzas para salir adelnate.
texts.en:
The Reyna Solidarity Group has worked with “Fundación” for a long time. For that reason this is not their first loan. In fact, they both have taken maximum advantage of it in order to invest in their businesses. Reyna is in the business of making and selling tortillas. She has worked in this business for 15 years because it is a means of subsistence for her and her family. With the help of Don Luis they managed to form a group in order to obtain financing and provide their businesses with the working capital necessary for success. They both have the same determination to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 40 years old. She is married and has eight children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the western region of Ghana. Felicia works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. Felicia runs a chop bar in her community. She prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes. She has hired extra hands who work for her. Felicia buys foodstuffs such as maize, cassava, plantain, vegetables, etc. from nearby towns. She has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a 35-year-old married mother of two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the western region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Doris is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She sells at the market square in her community. Doris also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community and treks as well. She buys the goods from nearby towns. Doris has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es:
Rosmeri es una jovencita muy talentosa de 18 años, actualmente vive en la casa de sus abuelos.
En su condición de nieta es la que más apoya a sus abuelos, ya sea en los cultivos agrícolas o en la venta de productos comestibles en la pequeña bodega de su abuela. Para Rosmeri, estas labores no le parecen pesadas, pues se siente muy feliz de serle útil a la mujer quien la crió desde su infancia. 
Ahora Rosmeri piensa independizarse económicamente mediante la siembra de plátanos y café, en las chacras de su abuelo, ya que de ese modo quiere sacarle provecho a esas tierras; pero recalca no dejará de ayudar a sus abuelos, ya que para ella lo son todo en la vida.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas en las fechas señaladas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de 500 plantitas de plátanos para sus primeras siembras independientes.
texts.en:
Rosmeri is a very talented young lady, aged 18, who currently lives in her grandparents' house. As their granddaughter, it is Rosmeri who is the main help of her grandparents, whether by growing crops or selling food products in her grandmother's convenience store. She does not regard this work as a burden, as she is very happy to be useful to the woman who raised her since childhood. Currently Rosmeri wants to become economically independent by planting bananas and coffee in her grandfather’s fields, because that is the way she wants to profitably exploit the land. However, she emphasizes her intention not to stop helping her grandparents, because they are everything in her life. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is committed to paying her installments at the indicated dates. She will use the requested money to buy 500 baN. seedlings for her very own first crop.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy banana seedlings

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is 32 years old. She is married and has three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Gifty works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar in her community. She prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes. Gifty has hired extra hands who work for her. She buys foodstuffs such as maize, cassava, plantain, vegetables, etc. from nearby towns. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy food items in bulk

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus dos hijos en su casa. Desde hace 7 años ha venido sembrando café y plátanos, ambos productos son muy importantes para su economía. Pero el que le brinda más ganancias es el café, por ello en estos meses de noviembre a diciembre se preocupa en abonar adecuadamente y de forma uniforme.
Para Víctor, dedicarse a sus chacras le complace de sobre manera, y más aún cuando lo realiza junto a su esposa. Cuando termina de trabajar en sus chacras, no le gusta estar sin hacer nada, por ello trabaja las chacras de otras personas, por lo que le pagan 15 soles diarios, esto mientras espera la cosecha de sus chacras. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, demostrando ser puntual en sus pagos y asiste a toda las reuniones de su banco comunal, ya que le gusta estar enterado de todo los acuerdos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Victor, 27, lives with his life partner and mother of his two children in his house. For seven years he has been planting coffee and bananas. Both products are very important for his economy. But, the one that offers more earnings is coffee. Therefore, in these months of November and December he concerns himself with adequately fertilizing in a uniform manner. Working in his fields really pleases Víctor, especially when he works along side of his wife. When he finishes working in the fields, he does not like having nothing to do. So, he works on other peoples’ fields. They pay him 15 PEN a day. He does this while he waits to harvest his crops. This is his second loan with MFP. He demonstrates that he is punctual with his payments, and he attends all of his communal bank’s meetings. He likes to be informed about all of the agreements. He will use the money that he is requesting to buy chemical fertilizers for his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 30 years old. She is married and has three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Cecilia is a trader. She trades in stationery materials. She hawks to sell in her community and she treks to sell. Cecilia buys goods such as notebooks, diaries, pens, etc. from nearby towns. She has been in business for over 10 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy stationery in bulk

loans.name: Family United Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Family United Group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT for the first time to seek a loan of Le 2,500,000 (or Le 500,000 for each) to boost their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and consequently improve their living standard. 

Fatmata S. (second from left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka town. She is 42 and a widow with three children. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for more than 15 years now. Fatmata buys snails from Magburaka and sells in Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. And in Monrovia, she buys items like biscuits and mayonnaise and sells in Sierra Leone. She will use this loan to buy bags of snails to sell in Liberia.

loans.use: Buy snails to sell in Liberia

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 33-year-old divorced mother of five children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the western region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Grace is a trader. She runs a cold store in her community. She sells fresh fish and all kinds of fresh meat. Grace says she also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys the goods from big cold stores in nearby towns. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Kadiatou  S. est âgée de 24 ans, célibataire avec un enfant, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle élargie avec sa mère, ses frères et sœurs et son enfant dans la ville de Fana,  au quartier Millionkin (région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).
Kadiatou travaille au niveau d’un restaurant de la place. En plus de cette activité, elle fait des activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente, d’habits et de produits de beauté.
C’est dans le souci de diversifier ses activités, qu’elle décide de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, qu’elle vient de  connaitre à  travers une amie et  elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Avec ce prêt premier prêt, elle compte acheter, une quantité importante de produits cosmétiques. Son   approvisionnement se fait à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Les produits sont  revendus au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte obtenir 60 000 FCFA de bénéfice par mois qu’elle  utilisera pour soutenir de façon supplémentaire les frais de nourriture, de santé et d’éducation de ses parents.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadiatou S., aged 24, is an unmarried woman who has a child.  She lives in a traditional extended family with her mother, brothers and sisters, and her child in the city of Fana, in the Millionkin district (region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali).  Kadiatou works in a local restaurant.  In addition to this work, she has a revenue-generating business selling clothing and beauty products in particular.  Concerned about diversifying her business, Kadiatou decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which she just discovered through a friend. She is now on her first individual loan.  Using it, she intends to buy a major quantity of cosmetics.  Supplies are gotten in Bamako (capital of Mali), and the goods are sold for cash or on credit to customers composed of men and women.  With this loan, she plans on obtaining a profit of 60,000 francs CFA per month that she will use to provide additional support to her parents for covering the costs of food, healthcare, and schooling. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Maximo Antonio

texts.es: Máximo Antonio de 68 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de leña hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que su negocio ha crecido poco a poco ya que tiene su propio camión en donde ofrece sus productos en diferentes lugares y además el se queda en su vivienda porque aquí también ofrece este producto por lo que las familias nicaragüenses ocupan mucho este medio de cocinar, porque no tienen los suficientes recursos para comprar cocinas. El sueño de Máximo es ampliar su negocio en  zonas mucho mas rurales y así abastecería muchas comarcas más. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Máximo Antonio, 68, sells firewood. He has been in this business for over 20 years. His business has grown little by little. He now has his own truck he uses to offer his products in different places. He also stays at home because he offers his products there as well. Nicaraguan families use this method of cooking a lot because they do not have sufficient resources to buy stoves. Máximo’s dream is to expand his business into more rural areas. That way he could supply many more regions. The loan is for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia VALENTINA pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, es natural D. la provincia D. Calca, del departamento del Cusco, ubicado a una hora D. la provincia D. Cusco.
  
La socia tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada, tiene una hija y un nieto. La hija estudia la carrera profesional D. Medicina Humana en el país D. Bolivia.    

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención del pequeño negocio D. venta comida y bebidas en el Mercado Modelo D. la ciudad D. Calca. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio D. venta D. comidas y bebidas.     
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Valentina belongs to the Virgen Asunta Communal Bank. She is from the Calca province in the Cusco department, which is located one hour from the province of Cusco. She is 57, married, and has a daughter and a grandson. Her daughter is studying for a professional career in Human Medicine in the country of Bolivia. She alternates her activities at home with taking care of her small business of selling food and drinks in the Modelo Market in the city of Calca. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business of selling food and drinks. She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium. She promises to make her payments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the capital in her business of selling food and drinks

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 43-year-old married mother of three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities. Esther is a trader. She trades in plantain and other foodstuffs such as cocoyam. She supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also treks to supply. Esther buys the goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy plantain in bulk

loans.name: Sorry Heart Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Sorry Heart Group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 2,500,000 (or SLL 500,000 for each) to enable them to improve their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to add more goods into their stalls, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standard will improve so that they can better look after themselves and their children. 

The leader of this group is Isatu S. (on the left). She was born in Magburaka about 37 years ago. Her husband works at the Government hospital and her three children are in Junior Secondary School and primary school, respectively. Isatu sells local produce like pepper, onion, margi (used in sauce to give a sweet taste), fish, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) etc. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She will use this loan to increase the size of her business. Isatu enjoys selling these goods and finds it very difficult to change, as she is already well known for this type of business.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm oil, packets of margi, bags of onions

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is a 66-year-old widowed mother of ten children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the western region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Afia is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She sells at the market square in her community and supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. Afia buys the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for over 30 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits de premières nécessités. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle contribue aux dépenses de la famille. Son stock étant en diminution, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour se réapprovisionner avec 5 cartons de détergents « OMO », des produits laitiers et divers autres produits d’alimentation générale .
texts.en:
Married and the mother of two children, this woman has a revenue-generating business involving basic necessities.  With what she earns from her commerce, she helps to meet family expenses.  Having a shrinking inventory of goods, she's requesting a WAGES loan to stock up again with 5 boxes of OMO detergent, dairy products, and a variety of other food items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 40-year-old married mother of two children who are both in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment a farming community in the Western Region of Ghana.  Most of the community practices farming alongside other trading activities. Regina is a trader, running a cold store in her community where she sells fresh fish and all kinds of fresh meat. Regina says she also supplies fish and meat to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys her goods from big stores in nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and requests a loan to procure goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish and meat for her store.

loans.name: Khadija Kasim

texts.en: Khadija Kasim A. is a small business owner, and married mother of three children.  One child is in kindergarten, another is in primary school, and the other is in secondary school. She runs a café at Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam. She has been in this business for seven years. She purchases her goods from wholesale shops and at the markets in Vituka and Kariakoo. The income from her business helps her pay the school fees for her children as well as the daily needs of the family. She requests a loan of 1,200,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is a 35-year-old married mother of two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming community in the Western Region of Ghana. She works to help her husband provide for their family. Paulina is a food vendor, running a chop bar in her community where she prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes. Paulina has hired extra hands that work for her. She buys food ingredients such as maize, cassava, plantain, and vegetables from nearby towns. She has been in business for fifteen years and requests a loan so she can buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy food items in bulk.

loans.name: Ansorbeh Group

texts.en:
Adama T., Umu K., Isatu S., Fatmata S., Fatmata T. and Kadiatu T. are local entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They call their group Ansorbeh which is a Temne word for steadfastness. This group is requesting their first loan from SMT/Kiva, for the amount of SLL 2,500,000 (SLL 500,000 each). With the help of this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses by adding more goods into their stalls. This will attract many customers into their businesses and as a result their sales and profits will increase, improving their way of life. 

Adama T. is the leader of this group. Adama was born in a village call Songo, which is ~36 miles away from Magburaka town. Adama is approximately 37 years old.  Her husband is a driver and they have two children who attend primary school. Adama has twenty years of experience in business. She sells palm oil, the most popular cooking oil. With this loan, she plans to expand her business to also sell rice.

loans.use: Buy palm oil and bags of rice.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Seynabou M. est une femme mariée de 55 ans, mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce de draps de lit, de mil, d’oseille et d’huile de palme. Elle souhaiterait maintenir son activité et avec ce prêt arriver à obtenir son autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Seynabou M. is a married woman, 55 years old, and the mother of three children. She has a small business selling bed sheets, millet, dried hibiscus flowers, and palm oil. She wishes to keep up her business and, by using this loan, come to be self-financing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell sheets, palm oil, millet, and hibiscus flowers

loans.name: Bolotshi Plus Group

texts.fr:
Ngele B. 49 ans, est dirigeante d’une Banque communautaire dénommée « Bolotshi Plus » constituée solidairement de 31 membres avec un objectif commun de développer leurs petites affaires par des microcrédits reçus des prêteurs du monde à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Ngele a comme activité principale, la vente des pagnes wax anglaises. Elle l’a commencée depuis 2004 avec un capital initial de $20 et a acquit au fil des années une expérience solide dans ce petit commerce qui lui rapporte aujourd’hui un bénéfice de plus ou moins $120 par semaine. Le prochain prêt lui permettra d’acheter une douzaine de pagnes à revendre et diversifier l’affaire en achetant des articles divers recherchés dans son milieu. Son rêve est d’ouvrir une boutique générale pour répondre aux besoins de ses clients dans son quartier. Ngele est une cliente fidèle qui a reçu 5 fois les crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a tous correctement remboursés. Elle est veuve avec 3 enfants âgés de 10 à 16 ans. Tous vont à l’école. Ngele et ses enfants habitent dans une zone montagneuse située à l’ouest de la ville de Kinshasa.
texts.en:
Ngele B., aged 49, is the manager of a communal bank named "Bolotshi Plus", which is established in solidarity with 31 members with the common objective of developing their small businesses by using micro-loans received from world lenders via Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC.  Ngele's principal business involves selling Wax Anglaise pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  She started this business in 2004 with $20 in initial capital.  She has acquired over the years some solid experience in this small-scale commerce, which now brings in $120 a week in profit, more or less.  The next loan will enable her to buy a dozen lengths of pagnes to sell and to diversify her business by buying various goods in demand in her area.  Her dream is to open a general store to respond to the needs of her customers in her district.  Ngele is a loyal client who has received a loan from HOPE RDC five times, and she repaid all of them properly.  She is a widow with three children, ages 10 to 16 years.  All of them go to school.  She and her children live in a mountainous area located west of the city of Kinshasa.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dozen lengths of pagne cloth for resale with the gaol of  growing her income

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a 40-year-old divorced mother of four children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming community in the Western Region of Ghana. Felicia works hard to provide for the family. She is a trader of palm oil.  She buys the prepared oil from sellers in nearby communities and then sells it at the local market, and to retailers and food vendors in her community. Felicia has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy palm oil in greater amounts.

loans.use: To buy palm oil.

loans.name: Paix Plus Group

texts.fr:
Evelyne M. est présidente d’un groupe dénommé « La Paix Plus » composé de 29 micro entrepreneurs solidairement unis pour faire avancer leurs petits commerces aux moyens des microcrédits obtenus des prêteurs du monde par le biais de Kiva et de l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Evelyne habite et exerce son activité dans une zone la plus montagneuse située à l’ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Son activité consiste à livrer des pains dans son quartier et les environs. L’affaire lui génère hebdomadairement $66 de bénéfice. Evelyne est cliente fidèle de l’IMF HOPE RDC. Elle a déjà reçu 4 fois le prêt qu’elle a correctement remboursé. Elle compte avec le prochain crédit ouvrir un autre dépôt dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et d’augmenter le bénéfice. Son ambition est d’atteindre 5 dépôts de livraison des pains envue d’accroitre le revenu. Evelyne est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 3 et 19 ans. Trois d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Evelyne M. is the president of a group named "La Paix Plus", which is composed of 29 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to advance their small businesses by means of micro-loans obtained from world lenders via Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC. Evelyne lives in the most mountainous area located west of the city of Kinshasa where she operates her business. Her business consists in delivering bread in her district and surrounding areas. It generates a weekly profit of $66 for her. She is a loyal client of HOPE RDC. She has received four loans before, which she has repaid properly. With the next loan, she intends to open another outlet with the goal of meeting the needs of her customers and to increase profits. Her ambition is to achieve five delivery outlets for bread with the aim of growing her income. Evelyne is 38 years old, married, and the mother of five children, who range from 3 to 19 years of age. Three of them are in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open an other outlet for selling bread

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Siga

texts.fr: Siga D. est mariée, 39 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de haricot et d’oseille. Son objectif est de maintenir son activité afin de mieux aider à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Siga D. is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She works selling beans and sorrel. Her goal is to continue this business in order to improve her family's quality of life, health and education.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling beans and sorrel

loans.name: Donald

texts.en: Donald K. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and businessman. He is not yet married. He runs a foodstuffs shop and poultry farm at Lumo in Dar es Salaam. He buys and sells varieties of food crops. He purchases the business goods direct from the wholesale shops and from the suppliers at wholesale and sells to customers at retail. He also has 500 layers in the poultry cages. He sells eggs to wholesale and retail customers. The loan has helped him to expand the business by increasing the stock in the shop and opening a new poultry farm. He is requesting a loan of T. shs 1,400,000 to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 33 años de edad, la esposa tiene 25 años son casados, tienen 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 5 años respectivamente, tienen casa propia. Santos es empleado con más de 6 años de antigüedad, trabaja en la fábrica de aceite de la provincia,  la esposa se dedica al comercio de dulces por docena en la feria. La competencia en sus dos actividades es media pero por la antigüedad en el rubro  tiene ventajas. El crédito será destinado como capital de trabajo en el negocio de la esposa ya que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año y las ventas  suben y quieren tener  una buena cantidad de mercadería en esta temporada. Sus antecedentes crediticios en la institución son excelentes, esta es su cuarta operación y todas fueron canceladas con total puntualidad.
texts.en:
Santos, 33, is married. His wife is 25 years old and they have 3 children: 9, 7, and 5-years-old respectively. They have their own home. Santos has been employed for over 6 years by the provincial oil making company. His wife sells candy by the dozen at the fair. Both activities have moderate competition but his long history in his occupation has its advantages. The financing will be used in the wife's work since the end-of-year festivities are approaching and sales rise and they want to have a good amount of merchandise in this season. Their credit history is excelent; this is their fourth loan and all the previous ones were repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Amy Lèye

texts.fr: Amy Lèye D. est mariée, 38 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle s’active dans l’élevage ovin et la vente céréalière. Avec ce prêt, elle compte améliorer ses activités afin de satisfaire ses besoins financiers.
texts.en:
Amy Lèye D. is 38 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She works raising sheep and selling cereals. With this loan she plans to improve her business in order to satisfy her financial needs.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising sheep and small business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia LUISA pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, es natural de la provincia de Calca, del departamento del Cusco, ubicado a una hora de la provincia de Cusco.
  
La socia tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene cuatro hijos, el menor hijo estudia en el colegio. 

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención del pequeño negocio de venta comida y bebidas en el Mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Calca. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas. La socia quiere comprar insumos como azúcar, arroz, aceite, fideos, etc., para poder preparar más comida.   
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
LLUISA, 52, is a member of the "VIRGEN SANTA" communal bank. She is from the Calca province, Cusco department, which is located an hour away from Cusco province. She is a single mother of four children; her youngest son is a student. She alternates her domestic chores with tending a small food and beverage sales stand in the Modelo Market in the city of Calca. She needs financing to increase working capital in her food and beverage sales. She wants to buy consumables like sugar, rice, oil, pasta, etc. in order to be able to prepare more food. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase for food and beverage sales.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady T. est une jeune femme de 31 ans, mariée. Elle fait de l’élevage ovin et du petit commerce d’arachide, de haricot et d’oseille. Elle souhaite développer son activité et augmenter ses revenus financiers pour mieux participer aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady T. is a young 31-year-old woman who is married. She raises sheep and has a small business involving peanuts, beans, and dried hibiscus flowers. She wishes to develop her business and to increase her financial income in order to participate further in covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise livestock and to run a small business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma B. is a small business entrepreneur and a Tanzanian married woman.  She has three school children, one in kindergarten and two in primary school. She runs a business selling traditional clothes (Kanga and Vitenge) at Mtakuja Street in Vingunguti –Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business goods direct from the wholesale shops at Mnazi Mmoja traditional clothes shopping center. She sells to retail customers at Vingunguti. The business income is used to meet her daily family demand and business capitalization. The business plan is to open and run wholesale shops and open up another business. She is requesting a loan of T.shs 600,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods.

loans.name: Ndiarré

texts.fr: Ndiaré S. est une femme mariée de 49 ans, mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de pain de singe, de haricot et d’oseille. Son objectif est d’augmenter  son pouvoir d’achat pour participer à l’améliorer des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndiaré S. is a 49-year-old woman and the mother of five children.  She does commerce in "monkey bread" (the fruit of the baobab tree), beans, and dried hibiscus flowers.  Her objective is to increase her buying power to help improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in a variety of food items

loans.name: Makiese Plus Group

texts.fr:
Annie D. est dirigeante de « Makiese Plus », qui est une Banque communautaire de 29 micro entrepreneurs constitués solidairement pour faire prospérer leurs petites affaires à travers des prêts reçus de Kiva et de l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Annie gère sa propre pharmacie qu’elle a commencée en 2003. Elle aime son activité et rêve d’aller plus loin grâce à cet appui financier.  Elle a déjà obtenu 3 fois les prêts de l’IMF HOPE RDC qu’elle a payé totalement et à temps. Annie compte acheter avec le prochain crédit quelques médicaments tels que les antibiotiques à revendre pour accroitre le revenu. Son affaire lui procure aujourd’hui un bénéfice de $323 par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un jour un centre médical pour desservir la population de son milieu et étendre ses activités. Annie a l’âge de 34 ans, mariée et mère d’un seul enfant scolarisé et âgé de 4 ans.
texts.en:
Annie D. is the leader of "Makiese Plus" which is a community bank of 29 entrepreneurs established in solidarity to have their small businesses prosper through loans received from Kiva and from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC.  Annie manages her own pharmacy, which she started in 2003.  She likes her work and dreams of going further, thanks to this financial support.  She has obtained three loans before from HOPE RDC that she repaid completely and on time.  With the next loan, she intends to buy some medicines, such as antibiotics, to resell in order to grow her revenues.  Her business now brings in a profit of $232 a week for her.  Her ambition is to open one day a medical center for serving the people in her area and for expanding her work. Annie is 34 years old, married, and the mother of only one child, who is four years old and in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some pharmaceutical products, such as antibiotics

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria Lourdes tiene 55 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus 2 hijas que le apoyan en salir adelante. No es el primer crédito que tiene con Fundación León 2000 ya que sabe que por medio de los diferentes créditos ha logrado salir adelante porque son necesarios para que los negocio crezcan. Su mayor deseo es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios, porque están trabajando y no le gustaría que sus hijos no tuvieran esa posibilidad. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que es destinado para la compra de productos.
texts.en:
Maria Lourdes, 55, has sold clothing for over five years; her two daughters help her get ahead. This isn't her first loan with Fundación León 2000 and she knows that it's thanks to the various loans that she has been able to get ahead because they are necessary for her business to grow. Her greatest wish is to see her children finish their schooling because they are working and she wouln't be happy if they didn't have that possibility. The financing is to buy products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Joyitas De Alto Lima Group

texts.es:
Rosa C. es integrante del grupo Joyitas de Alto Lima, con 46 años  es casada y madre de 4 hijos, desde hace 10 años ella se dedica a vender plásticos, como bañadores, baldes, vasos, platos y otros, Rosa está trabajando con la familia de Pro Mujer desde hace 4 años, pero por razones de viaje se ha retirado, pero ahora está retornando a formar parte del grupo Joyitas de Alto Lima, un grupo nuevo y quiere seguir haciendo crecer a su negocio, por lo que necesita préstamo para comprar bañadores ya  que es el producto con mayor demanda.
Las compañeras de grupo de Rosa también tienen diversos negocios y todas necesitan para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosa C., 46, is a member of the Joyitas de Alto Lima (Little Jewels of Upper Lima) group. She is married and the mother of 4 children. For the past 10 years she has sold plastic items like: bathing tubs, buckets, glasses, plates, etc. Rosa had been cooperating with the Pro Mujer family for the past 4 years but, due to travel, had been absent for some time. However, now she has returned to form part of the Joyitas de Alto Lima group, a new group, and she wants to continue to see her business grow. She needs a loan to buy plastic bathing tubs since this is her highest-selling item. Rosa's fellow group members also have various lines of work and all of them need to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Martha del Socorro tiene 40 años de edad, y sus 2 hijos que solamente 1 de ellos vive con ella. Hace más de 6 años que cuenta con la actividad de mercadería en general, por lo que siempre es administrada por lo que hace la diferencia con Martha es que siempre trata de comprar lo que esté de moda, ya que por encargos de algunos clientes ella viaja a conseguir esta mercadería, algunas veces es muy arriesgado por no consigue traer todos los encargos por no tener suficiente capital. Sus deseos son que su hija maneje el negocio sin ningún problema. El financiamiento ser utilizado para pantalones, camisetas, faldas, calzado, cosméticos, ropa interior y trajes para niños de 5 a 10 años.
texts.en:
Martha del Socorro, 40, has two children, one of whom still lives with her. For over six years she has sold general merchandise. Martha's administrative touch that makes the difference is that she always tries to stock items that are in style since she travels to get items her customers order. Sometimes this is very risky because she doesn't always have enough capital to bring back all the items that have been requested. Her wish is that her daughter run the business without any problems. The financing will be used to buy pants, t-shirts, skirts, footwear, cosmetics, underwear and children's clothing for ages 5 to 10.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya S. is an entrepreneur and a Tanzanian married woman with eight children. Seven of her children already work and one child is still in secondary school. She started a charcoal business, which enabled her to open up a new grocery business, and she plans to open a wholesale rice shop. The business income also enables her to meet her family's daily demands and pay school fees for her son. She is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,400,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Yamma Rosa

texts.es:
Yamma Rosa L. T.  es una señora de 44 años de edad quien vive con sus dos hijas y su pequeña nieta en una comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio

Doña Yamma Rosa se dedica a la venta de comida, ella tiene su negocio, una “soda” (un pequeño restaurante de comida criolla) en Upala centro ahí alquila un local para poder desarrollar su proyecto. Dice que de esta forma puede mitigar los gastos en su casa y que además se siente feliz de tener su propio negocio ya que ha tenido muy  buena aceptación.
 
Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢680.000(seiscientos ochenta mil colones) para comprar más mercadería que pueda vende y así podrá surtir sus platillos. Espera que este crédito le ayude a que su negocio crezca y le genere buenas ganancias ya que desea montar su negocio en un local propio y no tener que alquilar más, además de brindar un mejor servicio a sus vecinos y turistas que pasen por la zona. 

Doña Yamma Rosa es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su cuarto préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Yamma Rosa L. T., 44, lives with her two daughters and her little granddaughter in a community called Canalete, which is located in Upala in the Alajuela province. This is a semi-mountainous area whose primary economic activity is agriculture, especially cattle raising. It is a community rich in opportunities for development and microenterprise establishment, both in agroindustry and in commerce. Yamma Rosa sells prepared meals; she has a business called a "soda" (a small restaurant that serves indigenous dishes) in downtown Upala. She rents space there to carry out her project. She says this allows her to meet her household expenses and it also makes her happy to have her own business since it has been well received. She needs a 680,000 colon loan to buy merchandise to sell and to make up her dishes. She hopes that this financing will help her business grow and generate good profits since she would like to set up her business in her own site and not have to pay rent anymore, besides offering a better service to her neighbors and tourists who pass through the area. Yamma Rosa is a member of the Canalete Communal Credit Company, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA, Costa Rica. This will be her fourth loan and she expects to continue growing personally and economically with it besides actively participating again in a community credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elus Plus Group

texts.fr:
Simon L. est président de la Banque communautaire dénommée « Elus Plus », constituée de 24 micro entrepreneurs qui ont solidairement décidé de contracter des microcrédits au près de l’IMF HOPE RDC et Kiva en vue de rendre leurs petites affaires prospères.
Simon L. 34 ans, a comme activité principale la vente des pièces électriques au marché situé au sud-ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Il a commencé à exercer ce petit commerce depuis 1997. Il en a acquis une solide expérience. Simon vend en plein air et cherche maintenant à l’aide des prêts à vendre à l’intérieur pour éviter toute intempérie. Actuellement, l’activité lui génère un bénéfice de $380 par mois. Le prochain prêt lui permettra d’acheter quelques pièces électriques à revendre pour renforcer son affaire. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une quincaillerie dans son milieu. Simon est séparé et père de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 3 et 14 ans. Quatre d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
