Simon L. is the president of the community bank named "Elus Plus" which is composed of 24 micro-entrepreneurs who decided in solidarity to take out micro-loans from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC and from Kiva with the aim of making their small businesses prosper.  Simon L., aged 34, has a business selling electrical goods at the market located southwest of the city of Kinshasa.  He started operating this small-scale business in 1997 and has acquired solid experience in it.  He sells in the open air.  With the aid of loans, he is currently seeking to sell inland, so as to avoid bad weather.  Right now, his business generates a profit of $380 per month for him.  The next loan will enable him to buy a few electrical items to resell for bolstering his business.  His ambition is to open a hardware store in his area.  Simon is separated and the father of five children, ranging from 3 to 14 years of age.  Four of them are in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To by a few electrical items to resell with the goal of growing his revenues

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Cette femme  a commencé en 2000 le commerce de produits cosmétiques, elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante  ce qui lui permet de toucher un plus grand nombre de clients.  La demande actuelle de ses clients est élevée et le peu de stock dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de pouvoir  les satisfaire  raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de pommades, 5 sachets de chouchoux,  2 petits cartons de rouge à lèvre.
Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a woman who started doing commerce in cosmetics in 2000.  She sells from place to place, and this enables her to reach a greater number of customers.  The current demand from her customers is high, and the little merchandise she has will not allow her to satisfy it.  And so, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 2 boxes of ointments, 5 packets of scrunchies, and 2 small boxes of lipstick.  She is married and the mother of three children.  With the revenues from her commerce, she helps to meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ointments, scrunchies, boxes of lipstick, and various other goods

loans.name: Yngrid

texts.es:
La socia YNGRID pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, es natural de la provincia de Calca, del departamento del Cusco, ubicado a una hora de la provincia de Cusco. La socia tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente.

Ella alterna sus actividades del trabajo con los estudios. Ella trabaja en el hotel alternando las actividades de barman, housekiping, recepciónista, etc. desde las 8am a 2pm. Cuando termina de trabajar ella viaja a la Ciudad del Cusco donde se encuentra su centro de estudios el Instituto Superior “Esitur”. Ella esta estudiando la carrera profesional de Turismo para ser guía de turismo desde las 3pm hasta las 8pm.   
 
La socia requiere el préstamo para pagar sus estudios y también para sus gastos personales. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
YNGRID, 25, is a member of the "VIRGEN ASUNTA" communal bank. She is from the Calca province, Cusco department, located an hour away from Cusco province. She lives with her life partner. She alternates work with school. She works in a hotel doing several jobs: barkeep, housekeeping, receptionist, etc. from 8am to 2pm. When she gets off work she travels to the city of Cusco where her school, the Instituto Superior "Esitur" is located. She is majoring in Tourism in order to become a tour guide. Classes are from 3pm until 8pm. She needs financing to pay for her schooling as well as for her personal expenses. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For educational expenses at the Superior Institute

loans.name: Mawena

texts.fr:
Son stock étant en baisse et pour pouvoir bien vendre en période de fêtes, cette dynamique femme revendeuse de pagnes sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 45 pagnes HI-TARGET, 20 pagnes JAVA, 10 pagnes PHOENIX.  Elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.
Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, l’activité qu’elle exerce lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière à son foyer.
texts.en:
Her inventory being low and to sell more during the holidays, this energetic women who is a retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 45 lengths of HI-TARGET pagnes, 20 of JAVA, and 10 of PHOENIX. She sells from place to place and supplies herself at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She is married and the mother of four children. The business she has allows her to do her financial share for her home.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagne" cloth of different makes

loans.name: Isolda Nicolasa

texts.es: Isolda Nicolasa tiene la edad de 45 años. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, que lucha por sacarlos adelante y que los prepara para el día de mañana. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa de manera  ambulante. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que dio inicio a esta actividad desde muy joven ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y seguir adelante, su mayor desafío fue que no tenía conocimientos de los lugares en donde ofrecían las mercaderías a un precio favorable, pero fue por medio de una amiga que salió adelante. Por lo que ahora el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones para caballeros, trajes para damas, camisas, faldas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Isolda Nicolasa, 45, has three childen under her care; she struggles to get them ahead and prepare them for the future. She has been a traveling clothing merchant for the past 10 years. She began working very young because she has always enjoyed work and to get ahead. Her greatest obstcle was that she wasn't aware of the places where merchandise could be had for a favorable price but a girlfriend helped her continue forward. She needs financing now to buy men's pants, women's outfits, shirts, skirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius M. is an entrepreneur who is a married Tanzanian man. He runs a general shop at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases and sells different kinds of goods including bags, clothes and shoes. He has been in the business for six years. The business income helped him to construct a house and capitalize the business. He is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,400,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Massile

texts.fr: Après remboursement d’un premier crédit qu’elle a obtenu de WAGES, cette dame veut profiter de la période des fêtes de  fin d’année pour augmenter ses recettes, elle sollicite donc de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour agrandir son stock avec une vingtaine de pagnes, des assiettes et des casseroles.
texts.en:
After repaying an initial loan, which she obtained from WAGES, this lady wants to take advantage of the year-end holiday period to increase her income.  She's therefore requesting a second loan from WAGES to enlarge her inventory with 20 lengths of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and some dishes and pots. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagne" cloth, dishes, and pots

loans.name: Siyaratou

texts.fr:
En 2004 cette dame a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle elle exerce le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Son stock actuel de marchandises a connu une baisse, elle veut rehausser son stock, pour cela elle s’adresse à WAGES pour acheter 3 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 2 cartons de laits « PEAK », des boîtes de conserve en tomates.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants
texts.en:
In 2004, this lady opened her own shop in which she runs a business selling grocery items.  She stocks up at the grand marketplace of Lomé.  Her current stock of merchandise has experienced a drop.  She wants to replenish it. To do so, she's inquiring with WAGES to buy 3 boxes of pasta, 2 boxes of PEAK milk, and some canned tomatoes.  She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
La socia AYDEE pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, es natural de la provincia de Calca, del departamento del Cusco, ubicado a una hora de la provincia de Cusco.
  
La socia tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo de siete años que cursa el segundo grado de primaria. Ella es profesora de educación primaria.  
 
Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención a su hijo y con el trabajo. Ella trabaja en el programa “PRONOEI” es un institución educativa que ayuda a niños de 5 a 7 años.    

La socia requiere el préstamo para los gastos del hogar y la educación de su hijo.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
AYDEE, 25, is a memger of the "VIRGEN ASUNTA" communal bank. She is from Calca, Cusco department, which is an hour away from the city of Cusco. She has a life partner and a 7-year-old son who is in the second grade. She is an elementary school teacher. She alternates her household chores with caring for her son and with work. She works for the "PRONOEI" program which is an educational institution that helps children from 5 to 7 years of age. She needs this financing to pay household expenses and for her son's educational costs. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her son's monthly school fees and for personal expenses.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M. is an entrepreneur, a Tanzanian, and a married businessman. He runs a foodstuffs shop at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases his business goods from the wholesale and retail shops and sells retail to his customers.

The business income enabled Charles to purchase a plot of land for house construction and also to meet his daily family needs and business capitalization requirements.

Charles has been running the business for four years and he needs a loan of Tsh 800,000 to capitalize his business.

loans.use: To capitalize his business

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle maîtrise son commerce et a appris cela de sa maman qui était une revendeuse. Son mari est à la retraite et ce qu’elle gagne comme bénéfice lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille. Elle s’approvisionne à lomé.La période des fêtes approche et elle souhaiterait gonfler son stock qui est épuisé pour vendre plus,raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 pagnes HI-TARGET, 30 pagnes PHOENIX, 25 pagnes WAX.
texts.en:
This woman has a revenue-generating business selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  She is mastering her commerce, which she learned from her mom, who was a retailer.  Her husband is retired, and what she earns in profits enables her to help cover family expenses.  She supplies herself in Lomé.  The holiday period is approaching, and she would like to expand her inventory, which is exhausted, in order to sell more.  These are the reasons for her request for a WAGES loan, so as to buy 30 lengths of HI-TARGET pagnes, 30 of PHOENIX, and 25 of WAX.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagne" cloth

loans.name: El Arroyo Unido 1,2 Y 5 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia (far-left in the photo) is the coordinator of her group: “El Arroyo Unido”. She lives in a rural community in the Dominican Republic province of Samanà. This area is quite isolated, thus small-scale businesses like the ones the members of El Arroyo Unido are running are an essential part of the regional economy and development.

Altagracia sells clothing and jewelry articles for a living. She usually takes requests from her clients and then travels to Santo Domingo (a three and a half hour bus ride) to purchase the ordered items from her supplier. She is constantly looking for new suppliers in the capital city so she can offer a wider range of items with the best prices possible.

One of Altagracia’s dreams is to have her own store to sell her articles. She even sees herself in the future managing a big store, selling a lot of different products and hiring employees. With this new loan, her purpose is to either buy or arrange a locality so she can start pursuing this dream.

With the incomes generated by her business, Altagracia wants, aside from the money she will reinvest in her business, to make personal savings so she can buy her own house one day.

Altagracia and the other group members want to thank you for your trust and support.

loans.use: To set up a locality to sell her merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 47 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia. La mayor parte de su tiempo trabaja como jornalero en las chacras de sus familiares y vecinos, por lo que le pagan 15 soles, incluido almuerzo o 18 soles sin almuerzo. En esta actividad labora desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, y en todo este tiempo se ganado el reconocimiento por su  puntualidad y cumplimento de su trabajos, es por ello que es muy querido y algunas veces no se da abasto para trabajar en sus propias chacras de café y plátanos.
Pero para las cosechas de café deja sus labores como jornalero y juntamente con su esposa  recolectan los granos los llevan a vender a las acopiadoras de la ciudad, terminada eso regresan muy contentos a su casa con los alimentos para todo mes.

Él tiene buenas expectativas de MFP, ya que por primera vez trabaja con una entidad microfinanciera, en su banco comunal se lleva bien con todos sus compañeros, y a su vez se compromete a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Alberto is 47 years old and lives in his own home with his partner, who is the mother of his two children. He spends the majority of his time working as a day laborer on the farms of his relatives and neighbors, for which they pay him 15 soles including lunch, or 18 soles without lunch. In this activity he works from 7 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon, and over time he has gained recognition for his punctuality and the quality of his work. For this reason he is very much in demand, and at times does not even have time to work on his own fields of coffee and bananas. But for the coffee harvest he leaves his work as a day laborer and, jointly with his wife, collects the beans that they take to sell to the buyers in the city. Once they finish with this, they return very satisfied to their home with food for the whole month. He has high expectations for MFP, since this is the first time that he has worked with a microfinance entity. In his communal bank, he gets along with all of his fellow members, and in turn pledges to make his own payments on time. The money that he is requesting is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers to fertilize his coffee plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es una jovial mujer de 43 años, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.

La mayor parte de  su tiempo lo dedica a sus cultivos, trabaja macheteando y podando sus plantas de café y plátanos. Junto a su con su esposo, trabaja con mucho cariño y esmero, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta 5 de la tarde, pues de ese modo logra hacer que sus granos de café se desarrollen en perfectas condiciones, por ello su mayor preocupación es el abonado de este cultivo. En los años posteriores le gustaría incrementar sus cultivos de café para obtener mayores ganancias, ya que desea brindarles a sus hijos buenos estudios.

Este es su segundo crédito  con MFP, por lo que ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas en su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho aprecio. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Blanca is a joyful 43 year old woman, married, mother of three children, with whom she lives in a house they own. Most of her time is spent growing crops; she maintains and cuts her coffee and banana plants. She works with her husband with care and effort, starting at eight in the morning and ending at five in the afternoon, this way the coffee beans can develop in perfect conditions and the fertilization of this crop is what worries her the most. In future years she would like to increase her coffee plantation to obtain more profits, because she wants to offer her children a good education. This is her second loan with MFP, she ratifies her commitment to pay punctually at the community bank, bank that she appreciates a lot. The money requested is to purchase fertilizer for her coffee plantation.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Fertilizer

loans.name: Emprendedoras De German Busch Group

texts.es:
Josefina H. de 53 años, casada y madre de cuatro hijos indica que es la primera vez que solicita préstamo ya que una amiga cercana a ella le ha invitado, porque hace 7meses ha emprendido el negocio de venta de comida y necesita comprarse una garrafa e insumos para su negocio, ella también ha conseguido un puesto en la feria 16 de Julio. El grupo al cual pertenece Josefina se llama Emprendedoras de German Busch y todas sus integrantes necesitan el préstamo para comprar insumos, materia prima y mercadería, según el negocio que tengan, así algunas se dedican a la costura, otras a la producción de zapatos, otras a la comercialización de regalos, verduras, detergentes y atención de tienda.
Liderizadas por su presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas, elaboran el reglamento interno del grupo.
texts.en:
Josefina H., 53, is married and the mother of four children. She indicates that this is the first time she has requested a loan thanks to a close friend of hers who invited her to do so. Seven months ago she started to sell prepared meals and she needs to buy a carafe and consumables for her business. She also has acquired a stall in the 16th of July marketplace. The group that Josefina belongs to is called Emprendedoras de German Busch (German Busch Enterprisers) and all its members need financing to buy ingredients, raw materials and merchandise, according to the type of work they do. Some may be seamstresses, others may make shoes, some sell gifts, vegetables, detergents, sitll others tend to stores. Led by their group president, recording secretary and treasurer, they are developing their group's bylaws.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients, raw materials, and merchandise.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora tiene 44 años de edad.  Tiene 4 hijos pero ninguno depende de ella. La actividad económica de Isidora es una pulpería. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación. Su negocio nació por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos, para el sustento diario de su familia, por lo que diario salía a vender ciertas golosinas pero esto lo pero ya estaba cansada de viajar todos los días. Y se ubico en su vivienda. Ella solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo e invertir el dinero en materia prima como golosinas, granos básicos, refrescos naturales, pan y gaseosas. Su sueño es que su pequeño negocio se convierta en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Isidora is 44 years old. She has 4 children, but none depend on her. Isidora's economic activity is a grocery store. For more than 20 years, she has been dedicated to her business. The location of her business is at her home. Her business started with the need to obtain a source of income for the daily living of her family. Prior to that, she sold some candy, but she became very tired of commuting every day, and now she is located at her home. She is requesting a loan for working capital and to invest the money in raw materials such as candy, basic grains, natural juices, bread and soda. Her dream is that her small business will turn into a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, basic grains, natural juices, bread and soda

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 28 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia. Desde que se formó su propia familia se ha dedicado únicamente al cultivo de café y plátanos en sus chacras de sus suegros, pero hace un año ha empezado a vender verduras. Para ello, todos los viernes por la madruga viaja la zona sierra de su ciudad para comprar verduras como: lechugas, espinacas, zanahorias, cebollas etc., y el sábado realiza la comercialización en su localidad, y esta actividad le es muy rentable porque por ser la única que vende estos productos en su zona. Elizabeth está muy contenta con su negocio, así tenga que viajar durante 4 horas siente no importarle mientras le sea muy rentable, ya que gracias a estas ganancias sus hijos no sufren de necesidades económicas.

Ella está muy agradecida, ya que con su primer préstamo con MFP, obtuvo capital para su negocio de verduras, por ello se compromete e inculca a sus compañeros de banco comunal ser muy puntuales en los pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo va a invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y para el incremento de las verduras que vende.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28 years old and lives with her partner, father, and two children in her own home. Ever since starting her own family she had been only in the farming of coffee and bananas on the farms of her in-laws, but in the last year she has also started to sell vegetables. For that, every Friday before dawn she travels to the mountain area of her city to buy vegetables such as: lettuce, spinach, carrots, onions, etc., and on Saturday she sells them in her area. This business is very profitable because she is the only person selling these products in her area. Elizabeth is very happy with her business, and even though she has to travel for four hours she doesn’t mind as it is profitable and, thanks to these profits, her children do not suffer from a lack of necessities.

She is very grateful that with her first loan from MFP she was able to use the capital for her vegetable business, for which she committed and fulfilled to her fellow members of the communal bank to be punctual in the payments. The loan that she asks for now will be invested in the purchase of chemical fertilizers and to increase the amount of vegetables that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Ener

texts.es:
Ener es un hombre muy laborioso de 31 años, está casado y es padre de dos hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.

Por más de 16 años se dedica a la extracción de madera de las zonas más recónditas y  profundas de la selva peruana y desde que se casó también empezó a sembrar café en las chacras de sus suegros. Pero lo que más le agrada realizar a Ener en sus tiempos libres (cuando se espera la cosecha) es cortar los arboles, lo hace desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, y después los va cortando con la rapidez y agilidad en sus manos, y el dominio de sus máquinas. Ener corta la madera de acuerdo a las medidas y pulgadas que le solicitan, de ese modo entrega prontamente sus pedidos, y esto le permite captar buen dinero. 
Él es le único en su pueblo que realiza esta actividad, por lo que le resulta rentable, pues todos sus vecinos requieren de su servicio para la fabricación de sus casas de madera. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que se vuelve a comprometer a seguir trabajando con la misma responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita es para compra de sierras, además de fertilizantes químicos para los cultivos que tiene con su esposa.
texts.en:
Ener, 31, is a hard-working, married, father of two children who all live together in their own home. For over 16 years he has worked extracting lumber from the deepest and most hidden areas of the Peruvian jungle. Since he got married, he also began to plant coffee on his in-laws' farmlands. What he likes to do most on his spare time (while they are waiting for harvesting), though, is to fell trees. He does this from 4am until 2pm and then, with great speed, agility in his hands and dexterity in handling his machines, he cuts them into lumber according to the measurements and sizes requested. He is able to deliver his orders quickly and this provides him with good earnings. He is the only one in town that does this which makes it very profitable since all his neighbors require the service in order to build their wood houses. This is his second loan with MFP so he, once again, commits to continue to work with the same degree of responsibility and punctuality in his repayments. The money he requests this time is to buy saws as well as chemical fertilizers for the crops he has with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy saws to cut lumber and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina started her day care business 6 years ago after working at an electronics factory in Fremont for eighteen years. When she suddenly lost her job, she decided to take early-education classes to prepare her for opening a daycare.
 
Cristina started her daycare business in her living room with a few toys and two children. She now takes care of fourteen children and works hard to stay up-to-date on child care information by regularly attending training. She is thankful that despite the economy, parents are still able to keep their children in her daycare.
 
Cristina needs $10,000 to replace uneven cement in her outdoor play area to make it safer for the children in her care. She also wants to replace the fence in her backyard. A loan from Opportunity Fund will allow her to do this without placing a burden on her family’s personal finances.

Cristina has been unable to get a loan from a bank in the past and finds it a stressful process. This will be her second loan from Opportunity Fund, and she finds the support of micro-lending services almost too good to be true.

loans.use: To replace the flooring and fence in the outdoor play area

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.es:
Gaudencia es una mujer muy laboriosa, tiene 68 años, es madre de 5 hijos, de los cuales, sólo uno vive en su casa. 
Cuando su esposo estaba vivo sembraban café, plátanos y piñas, pero cuando enviudó creía no poder con todas estas labores agrícolas, sobre todo con las piñas, pues es un cultivo es muy trabajoso.
Al principio era muy duro, pero con el pasar del tiempo ha logrado tener su cultivo muy bien cuidado, y ahora solo le falta un poco a abono para que este su fruto le sea tan rentable como aquellos buenos años cuando vivía su esposo. 
Gaudencia se siente muy feliz de realizar un buen trabajo en sus piñas, pero para las cosechas necesita contratar peones porque sola no podría con esta labor.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada, ya que esto le ha permitido sembrar sus productos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprar fertilizantes químicos para sus piñas.
texts.en:
Gaudencia, 68, is a very hard-working woman. She is the mother of five children, only one of which still lives at home. When her husband was alive they grew coffee, bananas, and pineapples. However, when she was widowed she couldn't continue with all these farming chores, especially the pineapples, because it is a very laborious crop. At first, it was very difficult; but with the passage of time she has managed to bring her crops to a good condition. Now, all she needs is a bit of fertilizer so that this fruit too will be as profitable as back when her husband was still alive. Gaudencia is very happy to be able to do a good job with the pineapples but she still has to hire some laborers at harvest time because she wouldn't be able to handle the work all by herself. This is her second loan with MFP and she's very grateful for the opportunity offered since this is what has allowed her to plant her products. With the money she is requesting now, she will buy chemical fertilizers for her pineapples.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is divorced. She has a grown son, Alexander. Yelena is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, where she sells women’s outer clothing in the central city market. She launched this small business 16 years ago. Presently, Yelena has about 21,000 grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly profit amounts to 5,000 grinyas a month.

Yelena is seeking a 10,000 grivnya loan to restock her merchandise and generate additional income. She realizes that access to loans is important for her business. She believes a good array of clothing items will help her better serve the needs of her clients and increase her sales. Additional income will allow her to invest more in her family’s well-being and provide a better living for her son and herself, which is her first priority in life.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Gencys

texts.es:
Gencys tienen 29 años, está casado y es padre de un hijo; con su familia, vive en su casa propia. 

Él se dedica a la siembra y cuidado de sus plantas de café, plátanos y piñas en sus propias chacras. De todos los productos, el más trabajoso es la piña, ya que debe trabajar 9 meses abonando y fumigando, porque en tiempos de siega se puede cosechar hasta tres veces, por ello para Gencys, no le resulta cansado por más que sea trabajoso. 
Con esta cosecha más la recolección de café, su familia no pasa necesidades económicas, es por ello que está prensando incrementar sus cultivos, asimismo le gustaría dedicarse a la venta de motos, ya que en su pueblo carecen de movilidad. 

Con su primer crédito pudo sembrar sus chacras de piñas y ahora con este segundo quiere fortalecer sus tierras, para ello se comprometo pagar puntualmente como hasta ahora. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, con los que va abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Gencys, 29, is married and the father of one son. He lives with his family in his own house. He cultivates coffee plants, pineapples and bananas on his own farmlands. Of all the products, the most difficult one is the pineapple which must be worked for 9 months, fertilized and fumigated, because in times of reaping it can be harvested up to three times. Because of that, Gencys doesn't find it tiring no matter how much work it entails. With this harvest, added to the coffee gleaning, his family does not suffer economic hardships so he is thinking about increasing his plantings as well as perhaps going into motorcycle sales because in his town mobility is lacking. With his first loan he was able to plant pineapple on his farmland and with this second loan he wants to fortify the soil and he promisses to repay on time as he's always done to date. The money he's asking for he plans to use to buy chemical fertilizers with which to fertilize his land.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio tiene 46 años, está casado, es padre de un hijo,  y con toda su familia vive en su casa propia.
Lo encontramos preparando sus sacos de café para ser transportados hasta la cuidad y a las diversas acopiadoras donde les compran desde 5 a 6 soles por kilo. El transportar estos sacos  de café u otras cargas es muy dificultoso para los pobladores de este lugar porque los carros ingresan muy esporádicamente a la zona. Es por ello que en una sola carga trata de llevar la mayor cantidad posible de sacos y de ese modo el resto de los días se dedica a trabajar sus cultivos de café y plátanos. Por más que tenga las dificultades de transporte se siente feliz de vivir en este lugar de la selva, además ama sus cultivos de café porque le son muy rentables en sus temporadas respectivas, y con ello los mantiene a su familia.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, asimismo hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas como hasta ahora, ya que el crédito es muy valioso para él. Con el dinero que ahora solicita va a comprar fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus chacras de café.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 46 years old, married, has one son, and lives with his family in his own home.

We found him preparing his sacks of coffee to be transported to the city and the many granaries where they buy the coffee for 5 to 6 PEN per kilogram. To transport these sacks of coffee to other places is very difficult for the people here because cars come very sporadically to this area. For this reason he tries to carry as many sacks as possible in one car and then the rest of the days he dedicates himself to working in the fields of coffee and bananas. Even though he has transportation difficulties, he is very happy to live in this tropical place, and furthermore, he loves his fields of coffee because they are very profitable in their respective seasons, and with them he supports his family.

This is his second loan with MFP, and he promises to pay his installments punctually as he has until now since these loans are very valuable to him. With this loan that he is asking for now he will purchase chemical fertilizers to fertilize his fields of coffee.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is divorced. She has a grown son. She lives and runs her clothing sales business in Melitopol. Ludmila sells men’s outerwear in one of the marketplaces in her hometown as well as in other small markets in the region. She owns two vending locations and always offers reasonable prices, which attracts many customers. Ludmila started this business 10 years ago. Currently, she has about 30,000 grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly income amounts to 9,000 grivnyas.

Ludmila is requesting a loan of 12,000 grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise. She believes financial assistance will support her in her endeavors. She is determined to work on her entrepreneurial dreams to make them a reality, understanding that real success and wealth take time. Ludmila is hoping to generate more profit and continue to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 37 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos, en su casa propia. 
En su juventud se dedicaba sólo a la siembra y cuidado de sus plantaciones de café y plátanos, pero ahora con el apoyo de su esposo, desde hace 10 años, implementó una tienda de comestibles en un espacio pequeño de su casa, donde vende abarrotes de primera necesidad, enlatados y bebidas
Luz atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, de ese modo ha ganado clientes, quienes le piden más productos, pero por falta de dinero no puede comprarlos, es por ello que recurre  a este crédito para incrementar la mercadería de su bodega, y así seguir siendo un apoyo económico para sus hijos y esposo. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde ha ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente cada uno sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luz, 37, lives with her partner, the father of her 4 children, in her own home. When she was younger all she did was farm and tend to her coffee and baN. crops. But now, with her husband's help, for the past 10 years she has run a small grocery store from a small area of her house. She sells basic needs items, canned goods and beverages. She waits on customers from 6am until 9pm. She has acquired customers who ask for more products but, because of lack of funds, she has been unable to get them. This is why she now has requested financing to increase the available stock in her shop in order to continue to be an economic support for her children and husband. This is her second loan with MFP and she promisses to make her repayments in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced. She has a grown son. Irina has been in the clothing sales business for 10 years. She sells children’s jean clothing in one of the biggest marketplaces in Zaporozhye. Since Irina launched her trade, she has managed to expand her small venture and purchased a vending kiosk and a vending tent in the same market. Both clients and fellow entrepreneurs recognize the wise pricing policy Irina has established. She has about 30,000 grivnyas in working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to 2,500 grivnyas.

Irina is seeking a loan of 13,800 grivnyas to increase her working capital. She is planning to purchase seasonal clothing in bulk to widen her assortment of inventory for the cold season. Irina understands the value of having readily available resources to help her business grow and succeed and is very grateful for the given opportunity.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nélida tiene 43 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 5 hijos, en su casa propia.
Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas; siembra café, plátanos y guanábanas en sus chacras ubicadas en una zona de la selva peruana. De todos los cultivos, el que le es más rentable para es el café, seguido por las guanábanas. En vista de que ya pasó la temporada de cosecha del café ahora está evocada a sus guanábanas, las cuales encajonó con la ayuda de su esposo y ahora está esperando a los camiones para enviarlos a los mercados de la ciudad de Lima, donde les pagan mejores precios, y con están ganancias Nélida y su esposo vienen cubriendo la alimentación y educación de sus hijos.
Ella se siente muy contenta de ser agricultora, no le parece cansad esa labor, ya que la realiza desde su infancia, además mediante ella capta el dinero para vivir con comodidad.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ratificar su compromiso de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y de asistir a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para compra de fertilizantes químicos con los que abonará sus plantas de cítricos y cafetales.
texts.en:
Nélida, 43, lives with her partner, the father of her 5 children, in their own home. From a very early age she has farmed. She grows coffee, bananas, pineapples and guanábanas (soursop) on their farmlands located in the Peruvian jungle. Of all the crops, the most profitable is coffee followed by the guanábanas. Seeing as how the coffee harvest time has passed she is now focused on the guanábanas, which she has boxed, with her husband's help, and are now waiting for the trucks to arrive to send them to markets in the city of Lima where they command better prices. With these profits, Nélida and her husband are able to feed and educate their children. She is happy to be a farmer, she doesn't feel the work is too tiring, since she has done it since childhood. Besides, farming is what produces money for her to be able to live with some comfort. This is her second loan from MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion and to attend all the communal bank meetings. The funds she is requesting now are to buy chemical fertilizers for her coffee and citrus crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 66 años, está casada y tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 6 de ellos viven fuera y en su casa sólo vive con uno.

Desde que se casó trabajaba arduamente en sus cultivos de café y plátanos juntamente con  su esposo. Pero de tanto laborar en la chacra enfermó de sus pies y desde entonces (5 años) implementó una tienda de venta de abarrotes en su casa.
Victoria se siente muy contenta de atender amablemente a sus clientes, y de paso va conversando con sus vecinos, de ese modo va ganado la preferencia de ellos, pues gracias a su concurrencia logra captar las  ganancias necesarias para su hogar.

Estuvo muy agradecida con su primer préstamo de MFP, y ahora para este segundo se compromete en seguir pagando de manera puntual todas sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita es para el incremento de su mercadería, pues le gustaría implementar los productos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Victoria, 66, is married and has 7 children, six of whom have left home; only one still lives with her. Since getting married she has worked very hard with her husband on their coffee and banana crops. But, so much field work caused her feet to become unwell and since then (5 years) she has run a small grocery store from her home. Victoria is happy to be able to kindly take care of her customers and, at the same time, have the opportunity to chat with her neighbors thereby winning their confidence because it's thanks to their patronage that she is able to earn enough for her household expenses. She was very grateful for her first loan from MFP and now, with this second loan, she again pledges to repay in a timely fashion. The money requested now will be used to increase her store inventory because she would like to be able to offer the products her customers are asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with two grown sons. He is a businessman from Kamenka, where he works in the sphere of construction, selling construction supplies and offering related services. Sergei has recently opened a small store and is hoping to stock it with inventory. He has been working in this sphere for over 5 years. However, he could make enough savings to open his own small store only this year. Currently, Sergei has about 60,000 grivnyas invested in merchandise. His monthly income amounts to 10,000 grivnyas.

Sergei is requesting a loan of 10,469 grivnyas to expand his new vending location. He has much experience working in the sphere of construction and remodeling, which helps him develop his business efficiently and consistently. Sergei is known as a hard worker with a very enterprising spirit. We believe the current loan will benefit his trade and help him expand it even further.

loans.use: To develop a new vending location

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y con el menor de sus hijos, de 15 años, en su casa propia.

Tiene 23 años de experiencia en las tareas del campo; diariamente, junto a su esposo se dirigen a sus tierras de cultivo y llevan a sus animales para que se alimenten, y regresan a casa cuando está a punto de anochecer. Siempre comparten las tareas diarias, todos estos largos años de experiencia les han servido para afrontar situaciones difíciles que ahora han sabido superar. Ellos tienen clientes que siempre compran sus cosechas directamente de sus tierras de cultivo, y cuando es la época de la cosecha sus demás hijos llegan y los apoyan en las labores.
Aydee y su esposo planean seguir dedicándose a la agricultura y a la ganadería hasta cuando alcancen sus fuerzas, porque es una gran satisfacción para ellos habitar en su tierra natal.

Esta es la oportunidad número 13 en Aydee tiene un crédito con MFP, ella está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal y su compromiso lo demuestra asumiendo uno de los cargos de la junta directiva de su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará para la compra de abono, semillas y fertilizantes para su  próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Aydee, 44, lives with her husband and her youngest son, 15, in her own home. She has 23 years of experience as a farmer. Every day, together with her husband, they head out to their fields and take their animals to graze. They return home at dusk. They always share their daily chores. All these long years of experience have served them well when they have had to face difficult situations and they have prevailed. They have regular customers that buy their crops directly from the fields and, when it is harvest time, their other children come back home to help with the work. Aydee and her husband plan to continue to farm and raise cattle for as long as they have the strength to do so because it is a great satisfaction to be able to live on the land of their birth. This is Aydee's 13th loan with MFP. She is happy to be part of a communal bank and she proves her committment to it by filling one of the positions on the governing board of her group. The funds requested on this occasion will be used to buy natural and chemical fertilizers and seed for the next planting cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural and chemical fertilizers and seed.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 36 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Hace 3 años se viene dedicando a la crianza de ganado vacuno. Se inició en este negocio por medio de un préstamo, el cual supo invertir muy bien. Ahora tiene ovejas y también siembra  alfalfa para la alimentación de sus animales, pues es muy importante que estén saludables, pues sólo así logrará una buena venta en la feria ganadera.
Para estas tareas cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en las tareas del campo, y lo que  desea para el futuro es aumentar la cantidad de animales que posee para que sus ganancias sean mayores.

Esta es la novena oportunidad en que tiene un crédito en MFP, ella es una persona muy comprometida con su banco comunal y su deseo es continuar progresando junto a su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita será para comprar sacos de abono, ya que sembrará más extensiones de alfalfa y también de papa.
texts.en:
Marlene, 36, lives with her 3 children in her own home. For the past 3 years she has raised and sold cattle. She started this business with a loan, which she invested very well. Now she has sheep and also grows alfalfa with which to feed her animals because it's important that they be healthy since that's the only way they will be sold for a good price at the cattle fair. Her children help her with her field tasks and her wish for the future is to increase the size of her herd so that her profits will be greater. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She is committed to her communal bank and she wants to continue to progress together with her group. The funds requested this time will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer since she will be planting greater areas of alfalfa as well as potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora tiene 64 años, vive con su esposo y uno D. sus hijos en su casa propia.
DesD. hace 7 años tiene una tienda que implementó en su misma vivienda, la cual está ubicada en una D. las avenidas principales D. su comunidad. Todos los días atienD. en su bodega, su esposo y su hijo también apoyan en este proyecto familiar, y en especial en estas fechas que hay mayor demanda por estar cerca D. navidad.
Este negocio le ha permitido durante estos años no depender solamente D. la pensión D. su esposo como jubilado, por lo que Teodora no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad para crecer, es por ello que siempre está al endiente D. innovar y mejorar su tienda para mantenerse activa.  

Esta es la octava oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy perseverante y a quien le gusta promover la unidad D. su grupo, por lo que es muy apreciada en su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en mercadería para su tienda D. comestibles.
texts.en:
Teodora, 64, lives with her husband and one of her sons in her own home. For the past 7 years she has run a small grocery store from her home which is located on one of the main avenues of her community. She waits on customers every day; her husband and son also help support this family project, especially during these days when the approaching Christmas season increases demand. The business has allowed her all these years not to depend solely on her husband's retirement pension for which Teodora takes advantage of every opportunity to grow. She always wants to be on the cutting egD. of innovation to improve her store and stay active. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is a persevering person who likes to promote unity in her group for which she is held in very high regard in her communal bank. The money being asked for now will be used to increase stock inventory in her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: La Sra. Gabriela hace más de 1 año que se dedica a atender su tienda ubicada en su domicilio en el Barrio San Francisco, vive con el Sr. Julio Cesar con el que tienen una niña pequeña, su esposo es musico y trabaja los fines de semanas tocando en fiestas, La sra Gabriela es cliente antigua en la institucion y es muy responsable con sus cuotas, actualmente en su tienda tiene un surtido de peliculas, cds musicales, regalos ademas de que acaba de implementar la venta de frutas y sodas por lo que necesita capital de trabajo ya que quiere comprar un freezer y una heladera más grande de la que tiene para vender sus gaseosas y frutas. Ellos es estan muy orgullosos del trabajo que estan haciendo porque saben que con esto le estan brindado mejores condiciones su familia, además que piensan en comprar una casa muy pronto para poder independizarse completamente puesto que actualmente viven en casa familiar.
texts.en:
For over a year Gabriela has run her small grocery store from her home in the Barrio San Francisco. She lives with Julio Cesar with whom she has a little girl. Her husband is a musician and works week-ends playing at parties. Gabriela is a long-standing client of the institution and is very responsible with her repayments. Currently, her store has a supply of movies, music CDs, and gifts. In addition, she just started to sell fruits and soft-drinks. They are very proud of the work they are doing because they know that with it they are improving their family's living conditions. Besides, they plan to buy a house very soon to become completely independent because they are now still living with their parents.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital and inventory.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: La Señora Gabriela vive en el Barrio Jardin Latino en la zona de la Radial 17 y 1/2, actualmente ella tiene su tienda de venta de ropa en la Nueva Feria de Barrio Lindo los dias miercoles y sabado, necesita capital de trabajo ya que las ventas en los ultimos meses del año suben porque salen a vender todos los dias a partir de diciembre por las fiestas de fin de año, ella tiene dos hijos que aun no van a la escuela, su pareja trabaja de cajero en una farmacia todos los dias, por lo que ella ademas de atender su negocio esta criando sus hijos, ella su pareja esperan poder comprarse una casa el año que viene y poder pagarla de a poco con su negocio, para poder darle a sus familia ambientes comodos y poder independizarse, ella se siente muy orgullosa de su trabajo y esta muy contenta con las oportunidades que le brinda Emprender .
texts.en:
. Gabriela lives in the Bario Jardin Latino in the Radial 17 and 1/2 zone. She has a clothing sales stand in the Barrio Lindo New Fair on Wednesdays and Saturdays. She needs working capital because sales tend to increase during the final months of the year because she sells every day during December leading up to the end-of-year holidays. She has two young children who are still too young to go to school. Her partner works as a cashier in a pharmacy every day which means that she, besides tending to her business, must care for her children. She and her partner hope to be able to buy a house next year and pay for it little by little with profits from their business to give their family a comfortable environment and to be able to become independent. She is very proud of her work and happy with the opportunities that Emprender offers her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase gasoline

loans.name: Santos Paula

texts.es:
Desde las Cinco de la mañana, todos los días en el mercado del departamento de León, la señora Santos M. se dedica a vender tortillas elaboradas por ella misma las cuáles son comercializadas a sus clientes que le visitan a comprarle por ser tortillas de alta calidad.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y por llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Solicita el crédito para la compra de la materia prima como lo es maíz, leña y cal y de esta manera continuar con la elaboración de las mejores tortillas del departamento de León.
texts.en:
Every day, starting at 5am, Mrs. Santos M. sells her home-made tortillas in the department of León's market to customers who buy them because of their high quality. She has distinguished herself by being very hard-working and for supporting her household. She is requesting financing to buy ingredients like corn, firewood and lime powder in order to continue to make the best tortillas in the department of León.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase food for resale

loans.name: Bernarda De Lourdes

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Bernarda M. se ha dedicado desde hace veinte años a la actividad de elaboración y venta de alimento los cuales son comercializados por ella misma en su propio establecimiento donde ofrece a sus clientes dichos alimentos que son de alta calidad.

El crédito lo ha solicitado para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima con el propósito de continuar elaborando los alimentos para que estos le generen ingresos y así continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
In the department of León, Bernada M. has dedicated the last twenty years to the business of making and selling food which she herself sells in her own establishment where she offers her clients high quality food.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy raw materials with the intention of continuing to make food that will generate income and so enable her to continue supporting her immediate family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodabi

loans.name: Nora María

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Nora O. se dedica a su negocio de venta de calzados los que son ofrecidos tanto para damas, caballeros y niños en su establecimiento.
 
Ella se ha destacado por ser una dama muy entusiasta y busca la manera de cómo mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para adquirir de sus proveedores la mercadería y así realizar sus ventas en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Nora O. sells footwear for ladies, gentlemen, and children in her business located in the department of León. She has been notable for being an enthusiastic lady who is always looking for ways to improve the conditions of her business. For this reason, she is asking for financing to buy merchandise from her suppliers to sell in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hairstylling supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodabi

loans.name: Manuela Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Manuela Yolanda R. se ha destacado en el departamento de León por tener su propio negocio de venta de refrescos los que son elaborados por ella misma todos los días para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.

El crédito que solicita lo utilizará para la compra de la materia prima como lo son las frutas, azúcar y bolsas para elaborar dichos productos y así continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Manuela Yolanda R. is notable in the department of León for having her own home-made beverage sales business which she offers her customers daily. The funding requested will be used to buy basic ingredients like fruit, sugar, plastic bags, to make these drinks in order to be able to continue to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her home-made beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy curtains to sell

loans.name: Ruth Caterine

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 53 años D. edad, es separada y madre D. tres hijos, vive sola en la ciudad D. Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. el 2002 tiene un restaurante que funciona en su casa, ella nos cuenta que este negocio empezó como picantería (establecimiento especializado en servicios D. bebidas y piqueos) y que poco a poco lo fue ampliando. Hace algún tiempo tuvo un pre – infarto y tuvo que suspender sus actividades temporalmente debido a que necesitaba descanso absoluto.

Lamentablemente después D. esa crisis fue diagnosticada D. diabetes, pero lejos D. desanimarse, esta enfermedad le sirvió D. motivación para seguir adelante, hace algunos meses volvió a abrir su establecimiento y ahora ofrece a sus clientes el servicio D. menú a la carta. Los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza en sus gastos personales y en el mantenimiento D. su negocio.

Ruth prepara sus platos con muy buena sazón por lo que sus clientes la han recomendado a otras personas que ya empezaron a frecuentar su pequeño restaurante, esta situación la ha motivado a querer ampliar su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para adquirir los insumos e ingredientes que necesita para preparar más platos. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella sueña con superar su enfermedad para renovar el mobiliario D. su establecimiento y convertirlo en un gran restaurante. Ruth es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos que la consideran una mujer optimista y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Ruth, 53, is separated and the mother of three children. She lives alone in the city of Lambayeque, which is 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. She has operated a restaurant in her home since 2002. She tells us that the business began as a picantería (a low-cost eatery specializing in beverages and small bites) which little by little she was able to enlarge. A short time ago she had a pre-heart attack and she had to temporarily stop work because she needed absolute rest. Unfortunately, after that health crisis she was diagnosed with diabetes but, far from being discouraged, the illness was the motivation for her to continue forward and a few months ago she reopened her eatery offering her customers prepared meals a la carte. The income she earns is used for personal expenses and to maintain her business. Ruth prepares very tasty dishes so her customers have refered her to others who are starting to frequent her small restaurant. This situation has motivated her to want to enlarge her establishment but she lacks the funds to buy more ingredients to prepare more dishes. This is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan. She dreams with overcoming her illness so that she can renovate the furnishings of her establishment making it into a great restaurant. Ruth is very well-known and held in high esteem by her neighbors who consider her to be an optimistic and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meal preparation.

loans.name: Serafin Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Serafin  se dedica hace 1 año a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio, durante mucho tiempo sólo se dedico a trabajar como Porfesor de Educacion Fisica hasta que se animo a colocar una tienda en su casa, la que ha mejorado con el tiempo, ahora tambien junto a su mama hacen pan para vender, él sigue ejerciendo de profesor en un  colegio publico, todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para salir a comprar las cosas que le hacen falta en la venta, atiende desde las 6:30 de la mañána hasta las 10:00 de la noche, tomo la decision de aumentar capital de trabajo y es por eso qe ha accedido a un credito con EMPRENDER, él esta muy orgullosos del trabajo que esta haciendo puesto que es padre soltero y debe dar el ejemplo a sus dos pequeños hijos que estan en primaria, por lo que esta muy contento de contar con el apoyo que le brinda la institucion y esta muy comprometido en no fallar, para ser un ejemplo para su familia. Desea con el tiempo poder hacer de si tienda un almacen para poder mejorar sus ingresos y darle mejores oportunidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Senor Serafin has sold groceries from his home for a year. For a long time he worked only as a physical education teacher until he was motivated to put a store in his house, which has improved over time. Now he also makes bread with his mother to sell, while continuing to practice his profession as a teacher in a public school. Each day he gets up very early to go out to buy the things that are needed for the store. The store is open from 6:30 in the morning until 10:00 at night. He made the decision to increase his working capital and this is the reason that he has applied for a loan with EMPRENDER. He is very proud of the work that he is doing, since he is a single father and must give an example to his two small children who are in primary school. He is very pleased to have the support that the institution provides, and is committed to succeed so as to be a good example for his family. He would like to eventually be able to make his little shop into a store in order to be able to increase his earnings and give better opportunities to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Flor S. se dedica a la venta de ropa comercializada en su propio tramo y aunque no presenta buenas condiciones por estar a la intemperie ella busca la forma de cómo continuar esforzándose para mejorar el negocio. 

Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de la materia prima que es la ropa para continuar ofreciéndola en su localidad y de esta manera contribuir al desarrollo de su familia llevándole el sustento.
texts.en:
In the department of León, Sra. Flor S. sells clothing from her own vending post. Being in the open does not provide the best conditions, so she looks for ways to strengthen and improve her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing so that she can continue offering her merchandise from her retail space. This enables her to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Francis Lisebeth

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Francis C. se ha dedicado desde hace doce años a la actividad de venta de queso y cuajada obteniéndolo de la materia prima que es la leche y vendiendo todos los días en su localidad.

Cuando inició en el negocio, ella vendía ambulantemente pero obtuvo un lugar que aunque no presta las condiciones necesarias logra realizar sus ventas desde las cinco de la mañana hasta que se le acaba el producto.

Ella ha solicitado el crédito con el fin de comprar los productos lácteos para continuar ofreciéndolos en el departamento de León.
texts.en:
In the department of León, Sra. Francis C. has worked for twelve years selling cheese and curds. She makes her products from raw milk and sells them every day from her vending post.

When she started her business, Francis sold her products as a traveling merchant but having a retail space has not always provided the best conditions for making sales. She begins selling her products at 5am until she runs out of inventory.

She has requested this loan so that she can buy more dairy products. This will allow her to continue selling her products in León.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Rosa Anastasia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Anastasia se dedica a la actividad de elaboración de alimentos siendo comercializados por ella misma y elaborados con la más alta calidad para beneficiar a los clientes que le compren. 

Ella requiere comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, entre otros con el propósito de elaborar los alimentos y por esto es que ella espera en que el crédito le sea otorgado y así continuar sus ventas en su localidad y así llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Anastasia sells food that she prepares herself. Her dishes are of high quality and provide enjoyment to the customers who buy them.

She needs to buy rice, beans, oil, and other products used in preparing her dishes. For this reason, she hopes her loan will be approved so that she can continue selling from her vending post and supporting her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grilled fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase condiments

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: La Sra. Delfina, es cliente antigua, trabajo varias secuencias en gupo solidario Estrella, ella tiene hijos mayores, todos casados, su esposo trabaja de  chofer de quien se separo hace muchos años,  su actividad es vender edredones y frazadas al crédito entre los trabajadores de la empresa constructora donde trabaja más de 5 años como pintor albañil, la señora es una perosona muy trabajadora por lo que se le da este trato prefeencial.Ella tiene buen historial y cumle con sus pagos de acuerdo a lo planificado.
texts.en:
Delfina is a long time member. She has been with the communal bank “Estrella” for several loan cycles. She has grown children, all of whom are married. Her husband works as a driver and she separated from him many years ago. She sells comforters and blankets on credit to workers at the construction company where she has worked for more than five years as a bricklayer and painter. She is a very hardworking person, which is why she is given preferential treatment. She has a good payment history and makes her payments as planned.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy comforters and blankets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy locks of hair for weaving

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.es: Don Ruperto hace 15 años que se dedica a conducir y alquilar su camioneta que tiene, realiza servicio de mudanzas o lo que desee llevar el cliente. Su esposa es ama de casa y es qiuien atiende  sus hijos cuando el no esta en casa, él necesita el credito para hacer mejoras en su camioneta puesto que el traslado de cosas la han deteriorado y necesita refaccion. Además cuenta con autmovil que tiene para trabajar como taxista, teniendo más ingresos para su familia, todos los días sale a trabajar con su camioneta su lugar de parada es el Mercadito de Los Pocitos, muy cerca de su casa porque ahi se encuentran las tiendas de ladrillo, cemento y otros que muchas veces transporta. En algunas ocasiones tambien realiza viajes a los otros departamentos llevando carga para algunos clientes. Él esta muy orgullosos del trabajo que esta haciendo porque sabe que de esta manera esta siendo un buen ejemplo para sus hijos, por lo que esta muy contento de contar con el apoyo que le brinda la institucion y esta muy comprometido en no fallar, para ser un ejemplo para su familia.
texts.en:
Ruperto has worked driving and renting his truck for the past 15 years. He takes care of moves, and hauls anything else that his customers request. His wife is a homemaker who takes care of their children when he is not home. He is requesting this loan for repairs to his truck, as much use has left worn and in need of repair. Ruperto also has a car which he uses for taxi work, bringing in additional income for his family. Every day he goes to work with his truck; working from a stop at Mercadito de Los Pocitos, very close to his home. He chose this place as it is near the shops that sell bricks, cement, and related items which often need to be transported. From time to time he makes longer trips to other departments, hauling cargo for some of his customers. He is very proud of the work that he is doing, as he knows that he is setting a good example for his children. He is very pleased to have the support that he has received from the institution and he is committed to not default, and to be a good example for his family.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying wholesale dishes for resale

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: La señora Amparo es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Manantay región de Ucayali, tiene 33 años, es madre  soltera  de un niño, ella se esfuerza por salir adelante y brindar un futuro mejor a su hijo. Amparo se dedica a la venta de bebidas y golosinas, actividad que lo realiza en su casa. Además tiene un bote que presta servicio de transporte fluvial en el puerto de Pucallpa. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos” desde hace cinco años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que utilizó en la compra de golosinas para vender en su casa. Actualmente la señora Amparo requiere un crédito de 2000 soles que utilizará para comprar gaseosas y néctar para vender en su casa. La meta de Amparo  es  tener una distribuidora de gaseosas.
texts.en:
Sra. Amparo is one our hardworking and active members. She lives in the city of Manantay in Ucayali region. She is 33 years old and a single mother of a little boy. Amparo strives to get ahead and provide a better future for her son. She sells sodas and candy out of her home. In addition, she has a boat that she uses to provide river transportation services at the port of Pucallpa.

Amparo joined the Carmen Cabrejos Communal Bank five years ago. Her first loan of 300 was used to buy candy to sell from home. She is now requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy sodas and nectar to sell from her house. Her goal is to become a soft drinks distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & nectar

loans.name: Doris Ortencia

texts.es: Doris es una mujer joven y dinámica, vive en el distrito de calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 24 años, es madre de dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carros. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien atiende en la tienda. Doris forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes II” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de accesorios para autos. Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 3000 soles, que será utilizado para la compra de repuestos de autos. La meta de Doris es ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de su servicio.
texts.en:
Doris is a dynamic young woman who lives in the District of Calleria, Ucayali region. She is 24 years old and the mother of two children. She sells auto parts. Her husband also helps with managing the shop.

Two years ago, Doris became a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Perseverantes II” (Persevering Women II). Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy automobile accessories. She is now requesting a loan of 3000 soles to purchase spare parts. Doris hopes to expand her business and improve the quality of service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase automobile parts

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
María Vásquez es una socia emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 38 años, es madre de cuatro menores, ella se dedica al alquiler de cuartos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la venta de aceite de copaiba (cicatrizante). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace un año y medio. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 500 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de aceite de copaiba.
En la actualidad María necesita un crédito de 1300 soles, que será utilizado en la compra de madera para la construcción de un cuarto que tiene en su casa, el mismo que pondrá en alquiler. La meta de María es tener una tienda de golosinas al por mayor.
texts.en:
María Vásquez is an enterprising and hard working member of a communal bank. She lives in the district of Calleria, in the Ucayali region of Perú, and she is 38 years old. She is a mother of four children and is dedicated to the rental of rooms. She counts on the support of her husband who works selling healing oils (for scars). She has belonged to the Community Bank “Juntas hasta el final" (Together until the end) for a year and a half. The first loan that she received was for 175 dollars (500 soles) which she used to buy healing oil. Currently Maria needs a credit of 450 dollars (1300 soles), that will be used to buy wood for the construction of a room in her house, a room which she will then put up for rent. Maria's long-term goal is to open a wholesale candy store.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood to construct a room

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
L. señora Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, tiene 64 años, es casada,  tiene 2 hijos, quienes cursan estudios superiores.  ElL. tiene estudios D. secundaria incompleta (tercero D. secundaria).

Trabaja con el Movimiento ManueL. Ramos desD. hace 2 años, se dedica a  L. compra y venta ovinos desD. hace 10 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 con el que compró 02 ovinos, como esta actividad no es diaria también se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. ganado vacuno y a L. agricultura para autoconsumo.

ElL. requiere un préstamo D. S/. 600.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa comprar 02 ovinos en L. feria D. Pilcuyo para luego venderlo en Ilave.

Le gusta ir a las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal porque tiene L. oportunidad D. ahorrar y compartir con sus compañeras.

Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos concluyan sus estudios y sean útiles para L. sociedad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elvira is a member of the Community Bank “Miraflores,” of the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 64 years old, is married, and has two children who focus on advanced studies. She completed part of her secondary school education (through the third year of secondary school). She has been working with the ManueL. Ramos Movement for 2 years, and has been dedicated to the buying and selling of sheep for 10 years. Her first loan was for $175 (500 Nuevas Soles) with which she bought 2 sheep. As this activity isn’t daily, she is also dedicated to the raising and selling of cattle and farming for her own family's consumption. She requires a loan of $225 (600 Nuevas Soles) in order to buy 2 sheep at the Pilcuyo fair that she will then resell in Ilave. She likes to go to the meetings of her Community Bank because she has the opportunity to save and share with her friends. Her greatest desire is that her children finish their studies and become useful contributors to society.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two sheep

loans.name: Juan Seminario

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el sector Muy Finca, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de animales desde hace más de 15 años. El suele comprar ovejas a sus vecinos para luego engordarlas y venderlas en la ciudad de Chiclayo, además cría vacas y vende diariamente la leche que producen. Por otro lado se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven. Actualmente siembra en un terreno que fue de su padre. Ha sembrado maíz y tiene planedo sembrar arroz en los próximos meses.

La críanza y venta de animales le provee de ingresos permanentes para sustentar a su familia. Juan necesita adquirir más ovejas para venderlas y seguir sacando adelante a los suyos pero las actividades agrícolas han hecho que deje de comprar nuevos ejemplares. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez  Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Su sueño es instalar en su casa un negocio de venta de insumos agrícolas ya que no hay ninguno por la zona y tanto el como sus vecinos tienen que viajar hasta la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirirlos. Juan es un padre honrado y muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Juan is a 37 year-old father who lives with his wife and four children in the town of Muy Finca, in Mochumí District, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He has been selling livestock for more than 15 years. He usually buys sheep from his neighbors to fatten them and then sell them in Chiclayo. He also raises cows and sells their milk on a daily basis. He has also been working in agriculture since he was very young. Currently, he is planting on a piece of land that belonged to his father. He has planted corn and he plans to plant rice in the coming months. Raising and selling livestock provides him an income so he can provide for his family. Juan needs to buy more sheep that he can sell so that he can continue to support his family, but his agricultural work has prevented him from buying new sheep. This is why he has decided to ask for his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of PEN 500.00. His dream is to open an agricultural supplies store in his house because there are none in the area and he and his neighbors have to travel to Chiclayo to buy supplies. Juan is a good father and is very hardworking.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

location.town: Sector Paredones - Muy Finca - Mochumí - Lambayequ

loans.name: Ismael Flores

texts.es:
Ismael tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su madre y sus seis hermanos en el caserío Punto 9, ubicado en el distrito de Mochumí, a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
