Se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, pero como esta actividad no lo provee de ingresos permanentes para apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia, hace 5 años adquirió una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utlizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que trabaja durante el tiempo en que no está haciendo labores agrícolas.

Usualmente cubre las rutas que unen a su caserío con el pueblo de Mochumí y con otros caseríos. Las distancias que tiene que cubrir son largas y muy accidentadas por lo que su unidad móvil ha sufrido serios deperfectos que necesitan de urgente reparación. Por este motivo Ismael está solicitando por primera vez  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ismael es un joven dinámico y muy emprendedor. Su más grande anhelo es mejorar la casa de su madre, debido a que está construida de material rústico y construir la suya para acoger  a su futura familia.
texts.en:
Ismael, 34, is single and lives with his mother and six brothers in the Punto 9 settlement, located in the Mochumí district, which is half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a farmer since a very young age but this occupation does not provide him with steady income to contribute to his family's support so 5 years ago he acquired a mototaxi (a motorized, 3-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) with which he works when he isn't doing his farming chores. Usually he covers the routes that unite his settlement with the town of Mochumí and with other neighboring settlements. The distances he must cover are long and over rough roads so his vehicle has suffered serious damages that need repair urgently. This is why Ismael has come to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to ask for a 1000 new sol loan. Ismael is a dynamic, very enterprising young man. His greatest wish is to improve his mother's house because it is made out of rudimentary materials and to build his own house to welcome his future family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 17 años en su casa propia.
Desde hace 15 años se dedica al cultivo de la tierra; sembrando trigo, cebada, habas y papa. Cada día hace un recorrido por sus chacras observando sus plantas, y una vez llegada la época de cosecha necesita el apoyo de toda su familia y también contrata a peones para recolectar y envasar sus productos en costales, los cuales son llevados el fin de semana a la feria comercial de su localidad. 
De esa manera obtiene las ganancias que se hicieron esperar alrededor de 6 meses, Gladys está muy contenta de realizar este trabajo, porque le permite disfrutar del paisaje y aunque el trabajo sea muy fatigoso esa es su forma de vida. 
Para los próximos años su deseo es sembrar mayores extensiones de tierra para poder seguir vendiendo sus productos y obteniendo mejores ganancias.

Esta es la novena oportunidad en que Gladys tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una de las socias más perseverantes de su banco comunal y la que siempre promueve el trabajo responsable. En esta ocasión, renueva su compromiso de pago para continuar recibiendo futuros créditos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará sacos de abono y contratará un tractor para remover sus terrenos y depositar la semilla.
texts.en:
Gladys, 37, lives with her husband and two sons, 16 and 17 years old, in their own house. She has been a farmer for the past 15 years and grows wheat, barley, broad beans, and potatoes. Every day she inspects her farmlands checking on her plants and, once harvest time is here, she needs the help of all her family and hires a few laborers to bring in and bag the crops. On the weekend, the sacks of produce are taken to the local market to sell. This is the way she gets profits she has been waiting six months to get. Gladys is very happy in this work because it allows her to enjoy the scenery and, even though the work is very hard, this is her way of life. For the next few years she would like to plant even larger spreads to continue selling her products and earning better profits. This is the ninth loan MFP has granted Gladys. She is one of the most persevering members of her communal bank and one who is always promoting responsible labor. On this occasion, she renews her commitment to repay on time so that she will be able to continue receiving future loans. With the funds requested now she will buy sacks of natural fertilizer and rent a tractor to till the soil and spread the seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer and rent a tractor.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo (Darío), de 46 años, y con sus 4 hijos: Karen de 12, Moisés de 11, Ruth de 9 y Benjamin de 4 años de edad. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia, ayudándose mutuamente.

Desde hace un año y medio ella se dedica a la fábrica de metales que con mucho esfuerzo logró poner junto con su esposo. Ellos funden bronce y crean peculiares llaveros de diferentes formas, los cuales son vendidos en diferentes mercados del distrito en el que viven. 
Darío, su esposo, es el encargado de crear los llaveros, dejando volar su imaginación modelando diversos objetos que van desde manos en miniatura, escudos de equipos de futbol, personajes de dibujos animados, animales, etc. Emilia lo apoya puliendo y dando el acabado final, poniéndole las argollas que sirven para sujetarlos y adjuntarlos a las llaves. De esta manera lograr buenos ingresos, ya que juntos son un gran equipo para el bienestar de su familia.  

Este es el segundo crédito de Emilia con MFP, siendo muy puntual con todos sus pagos y le gusta mucho ser parte de un grupo solidario, ya que todas sus compañeras son buenas amigas y muy responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará material para seguir elaborando sus bonitos llaveros y así incrementar sus ganancias y por ende su negocio.
texts.en:
Emilia, 43, lives with her husband (Darío, 46) and with their four children: Karen, 12, Moisés, 11, Ruth, 9 and Benjamin, 4. They all helpeach other out and live in their own house. After much effort, she and her husband managed to start a metal foundery and have been working there for the past year and a half. They melt down bronze and make singular, multi-shaped keyrings which they sell in various markets in their home district. Darío, her husband, creates the keyrings letting his imagination run wild shaping objects that range from miniature hands, to football team emblems, to cartoon characters, animals, etc. Emilia helps him by polishing and giving the final touches like attaching the rings that serve to secure the keys. This earns them good income because they make a good team working together for the wellbeing of the family. This is Emilia's second loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual with repayments and she enjoys being part of a cooperative group very much because all the members are good, responsible friends. With the funds she is requesting now she will buy supplies to continue making pretty keyrings and thus increase her profits and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos: Elías de 35 años y Fabricio de 5 añitos de edad, en su casa propia.

Ella se dedica a elaboración de prendas de vestir, actividad que desarrolla muy creativamente desde hace un año y medio. Con este negocio obtiene buenos ingresos para la manutención de su familia, ya que elabora cada una de sus prendas con mucho ahínco y dedicación, poniendo en práctica toda su creatividad, resultándole bonitos y variados modelos. Además de ello, también compra prendas ya listas, las cuales vende por su vecindario a pedido, resultándole muy rentable.
Para el futuro, Eugenia quiere tener una gran tienda donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas en grandes vitrinas y en un local que tenga gran afluencia de público.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, desde que se inició con su grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ropa de verano, ya que se acerca esta temporada. También adquirirá material para elaborar sus propias prendas.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 52, lives with her husband and two sons: Elías, 35 and Fabricio, 5, in their own home. She makes clothes, a creative activity she has undertaken for the last year and a half. With this business she makes good earnings to help support her family since she makes each item with much devotion and dedication putting all of her creativity into play; this yields beautiful and varied models. Besides, she also buys ready-made clothing items which she sells to order in her neighborhood. This, too, is very profitable. For the future, Eugenia would like to have a big store in a commercial spot that has a lot of foot traffic where she can offer her clothing items in large display cases . This is her second loan with MFP and she has always been very timely in her repayments ever since she began with the group. With the funds acquired she will buy a larger quantity of Summer clothes since that season is nearing. She will also buy fabric to make her own items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo (Florentino), de 59 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Flora de 19, Geraldine de 15 y Brayan de 5 años de edad, en su casa propia.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño mercado ubicado cerca de su casa, aquí ofrece diversidad de platos, como el tan solicitado ceviche. De esta forma abastece los almuerzos de otros comerciantes del mercado y las personas que concurren para realizar sus compras. 
La sazón de Feliciana es muy buena, pues a ella siempre le ha gustado la cocina, siendo para ella una actividad muy divertida, aunque muchas veces tiene tantos comensales que no se abastece en atenderlos a todos.
Por otro lado, al encontrarse tan cerca de su casa puede velar por el bienestar de sus hijos y esto la tiene tranquila y contenta.
Actualmente su negocio está arrojando buenas ganancias, pero ella cree que le sería más útil abrir un restaurante en su vivienda, así tendría más espacio y podría brindar mayores comodidades a la clientela, es por ello que está trabajando duro para llegar a este sueño.

Este es el primer préstamo de Feliciana con MFP y se compromete a ser muy responsable en el pago de todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos para elaborar sus platillos y así tener más clientela y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Feliciana, 41, lives with her husband (Florentino, 59), and their three children: Flora, 19, Geraldine, 15, and Brayan, 5, in their own home. She sells prepared meals in a small market near her home. She offers a variety of selections, like the ever-popular ceviche (raw fish marinated in lemon and garlic). This is how she provides meals for other merchants in the market and to market customers who come to do their shopping. Feliciana's dishes are very tasty because she has always liked to cook, an activity which is very enjoyable for her, although sometimes she has so many diners that she can barely take care of them all. On the other hand, being able to be so close to home allows her to watch over her children and this keeps her happy and worry-free. Currently, her business is producing good profits but she thinks it would be more useful to open a restaurant in her home; she would have more space and be able to provide more comfort for her clientele. She is working hard toward achieving this goal. This is Feliciana's first loan with MFP and she commits to being very responsible with repayment. With the funds she is requesting now she will buy larger quantities of ingredients to prepare her meals so that she can have more customers and have her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her prepared meals.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una entusiasta mujer de 38 años, vive con Andrés, su pareja de 41, y con sus 2 hijos: Carlos de 17 y  Brigitte de 12. Esta es una familia muy unida.

La venta de ropa es la actividad a la que se dedica Lidia, desde hace dos años comenzó en este singular oficio, a razón de que necesitaba sentirse independiente y apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar, y al conformar su propia familia no podía ser la excepción, ella comienza su trabajo desde tempranas horas en la mañana realizando algunas labores del hogar, para posteriormente dedicarse a su trabajo, visitando a sus amigas y vecinos para ofrecer su mercadería.
Lidia trae muchas novedades en cuanto a ropa, a ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le da libertad, solo que también suele ser muy cansado y peor en época de verano en la que el abrasador sol “no la deja trabajar en paz”, como ella dice. Aún así, es muy positiva y sabe que si sigue trabajando como hasta ahora logrará muy buenos resultados.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido una persona muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará gran cantidad de prendas de vestir y también mercadería para la época navideña.
texts.en:
Lidia, 38, is an enthusiastic woman. She lives with her partner, Andrés, 41, and their two children: Carlos, 17 and Brigitte, 12. This is a very united family. Lidia sells clothing. She began this occupation two years ago. She needed to feel independent and help to defray household expenses. From a very young age she has worked and, when she formed her own family, this could not be an exception. She starts work very early in the morning doing some of her household chores so that later on she can concentrate on her job, visiting her friends and neighbors to offer her wares. Lidia carries a lot of novel items in her clothing selections. She likes her job very much because it gives her freedom. At times, though, it can be fatiguing and more so during the Summer when the relentless sun "doesn't let her work in peace", as she says. Even so, she keeps a positive attitude and knows that if she continues to work as she has to date, she will see very good results. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has always been very punctual with her repayments. With the funds requested now she will buy a large quantity of clothing items and also merchandise for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo (José), de 37 años, y con sus 2 hijos: Luisa de 7 y Diego de 4 años.

Ella es una mujer muy alegre y emprendedora, es así que hace un mes incursionó en la venta de productos de belleza, teniendo anteriormente otros negocios, los cuales dejó porque necesitaba  de una labor que no le demandara mucho tiempo en la calle, ya que tiene hijos pequeños los cuales necesitan mucho de su ayuda en el colegio y en su hogar.
Es por ello que Nancy decidió dedicarse a esta actividad, pues puede libremente trabajar en los momentos en la que dispone de tiempo, ya que ofrece su mercadería a sus vecinas, amigas y familiares de la zona en la que vive.
Para el futuro quisiera tener un puesto en un mercado, donde implemente un bazar, ya que le daría la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más cosméticos, y también ropa para cubrir algunos pedidos que le hicieron sus clientes, incursionando también en este negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy, 24, lives with her husband (José, 37) and their two children: Luisa, 7 and Diego, 4. She is a cheerful and enterprising woman. A month ago she began to sell beauty supplies, having had other business ventures in the past, which she left because she needed to do something that did not require her being out on the streets for long because she has small children that need her help at home and with school work. She decided to start this new venture which allows her to go out on sales visits when she has free time since she offers her wares to her neighbors, friends and family in the neighborhood where she lives. For the future, she would like to have a stand in a market where she can set up a bazaar since that would allow her to increase her income. This is her first loan with MFP and she commits to be very punctual with repayments. The funds will be used to buy cosmetics and clothing to fill some orders placed by her customers therby beginning to make inroads into this type of business too.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Nathali

texts.es:
Nathali tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia; además está en espera de su segundo bebé. 

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la elaboración de lindos collares, aretes, pulseras, etc. las cuales elabora bajo la técnica de la bisutería. En esta actividad se ocupa largas horas de trabajo, ya que es una buena fuente de ingresos para su familia, además de ser un pasatiempo que le gusta realizar ya que puede poner en práctica toda su creatividad y plasmarla en estas lindas joyas. Posteriormente, Nathali vende esta mercadería a pedido, al por mayor, para luego ser vendida en los mercados y bazares de su localidad. 
Para el futuro, quiere tener otro tipo de negocio, aun no se ha decido por cual, pero sin dejar de lado el que actual hace, pues le gusta mucho.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, ella es muy puntual en todos sus pagos, al igual que su grupo solidario con el cual se lleva muy bien, pues todas son muy buenas amigas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita quiere comprar mayor cantidad de material para producir más collares.
texts.en:
Nathali, 25, lives with her husband in their own house; she is expecting her second baby. Since two years ago she has been making beautiful necklaces, earrings, bracelets, etc. which she makes using costume jewelry metholodogies. This activity takes up long work hours since it is a good source of family income besides being a passtime that she enjoys doing because she can put all of her creativity into practice and turn it into these beautiful jewels. Nathali then sells these items at wholesale filling orders for subsequent sale at local markets and bazaars. For the future, she wants to have a different kind of business; she hasn't decided yet what kind, but without leaving her current work aside, because she likes it very much. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very punctual with her repayments as well as with her communal group with whom she gets along very well because they are all good friends. With the funds requested now she wants to buy a larger amount of supplies with which to make more necklaces.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make necklaces.

loans.name: Luisa Petronila

texts.es:
La Sra. Luisa Petronila G. H. tiene 51 años de edad, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en Panamericana Sur Km. 297 – Subtanjalla – Ica. Actualmente es un modulo de madera ya que con el terremoto su casa fue afectada y aún no logran construirla.
Vive con su esposo y con sus tres hijos; de los cuales dos son mayores de edad y el último tiene 14 años en edad escolar.
Se dedica a la venta de chanfaina (Comida) de lunes a sábado por las mañanas de 7:30 am. a 11:30 am. Y por las tardes asiste a un Centro de Educación Ocupacional donde aprende a realizar trabajos manuales que le permite venderlos y obtener una ganancia.
Es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora, su esposo apoya en el negocio y también se dedica al campo ya que ellos tienen una pequeña chacra.
Los Sres. tienen buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos quienes dicen que son personas muy trabajadores y de esa manera han sacado adelante a su familia.
Está solicitando el apoyo para poder invertir mas en sus manualidades ya que es algo que le rinde y le ayuda para cubrir otras necesidades familiares y mas ahora que se acerca la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Luisa Petronila G. H., 51, lives along the Panamericana Sur highway, Km. 297 marker, Subtanjalla, Ica, in a wood modular unit because her home was damaged by the earthquake and they haven't managed to rebuild it yet. She lives with her husband and three children, two of whom are adults and the youngest is 14 and still of school age. She sells chanfaina (a type of stew traditionally made from the less-noble parts of the animal - offal) from Monday through Saturday mornings from 7:30 to 11:30. In the afternoons she attends an Occupational Education center where she learns to make handicrafts which she can then sell to make a little profit. She is a hard-working, enterprising woman; her husband supports her in her efforts and also is a farmer since they have a small farmstead. They also have good references from their neighbors who say they are hard-working people who have gotten their family ahead in life through their work. She is seeking funding to invest in more handicrafts since this is something that produces income and helps her meet household expenses and more so now that the Christmas sales season is near.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the Christmas season sales.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en: Mrs. Marianita P. is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and is blessed with three adult children. Marianita owns and operates a business selling a variety of clothes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than nine years and earns 10,000 PHP net monthly. Recently, Marianita is obtaining her 10th loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

texts.en: Mrs. Pilar S. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and is blessed with three adult children. Pilar owns and operates a business selling dried fish in the local community and earns 10,000 PHP monthly. Currently, Pilar is obtaining her 9th loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her existing business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Roque

texts.en: Mr. Roque M. is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old, is married, and is blessed with three adult children. Roque is a security guard of PLDT (Philippine Long Distance Telephone Company) and a motorcycle driver in the local community, earning 4,000 PHP monthly income. Currently, Roque is obtaining his 2nd loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP which will be used for buying housing materials and for his son’s tuition fees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay his son's tuition fees and to buy housing materials

loans.name: Tess

texts.en:
Mrs. Tess M. is 39 years of age and married to Mr. Edgar M.. Her husband is 34 years of age and a farmer. They are blessed with three children and all are in elementary level education. Tess is a retailer of goods in her sari-sari store in their village of Apiat, Aurora, Isabela. In addition to retailing goods, she also sells food. She cooks soups and pancit in the morning and barbecue during the afternoon. Tess knows how risky it is to become a businesswoman, but she is doing her best to manage her businesses for the welfare of her family.

The couple is doing the best they can for the future of their family. Tess is always dreaming of a good future for their family. Those reasons push her to keep on working and look for another source of income that can help her improve her business. Tess wants to acquire the amount of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her business

loans.name: Zonorov

texts.en:
B. operates a small boot-making shop in her town with the help of her husband. She worked in a shoe factory for five years and gained much experience and skill in her trade. She specializes in making warm winter boots for herders, so the winter season is especially busy for her. B. started her boot-making business in 2005 and has managed it successfully over the years. She is a very hardworking and open-minded businesswoman and always looks for ways to grow and expand her business. Her success has enabled her to build a house for her family and improve their quality of life.

Zonorov B. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. Her oldest daughter and son, ages 11 and 9, currently attend a local secondary school. Her youngest two sons are both in kindergarten.

B. has many plans for the future. She hopes to soon expand her production line by producing summer work and dress shoes. She hopes diversifying her products will increase her overall sales and stabilize her income throughout the year. As demand continues to increase for her boots, B. needs to expand her production capacity and purchase new machinery. She hopes that one day she will be able to provide quality boots to customers throughout her province. B. is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase two shoe-making machines and different types of leather for her shoe-making business.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase two shoe-making machines and leather

loans.name: Aurelia A.

texts.en: Aurelia A. M. is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Aurelia owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Aurelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Beng

texts.en: Beng B., 33, is single and lives with his parents. He resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he raises pigs and produces rice wine. He is able to earn an income of $8 USD per day from his businesses, which helps cover household expenses. B. and his family are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, B. is asking for a loan of $500 USD to purchase pig food and pig medicine. With the remainder of the loan, B. wants to purchase more rice to manufacture more rice wine to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy pig food and medicine, and rice to produce wine

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline P. is from the village of Zone 4, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Evangeline joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang O. is asking for a loan of US $600 to purchase a new motorbike for her family. O., 55, is married with three children. The family is supported by her husband (in the photo) who makes walking sticks out of wood, earning US $5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. To make a living, O. sells food (lunch and dinner) to her new and regular customers, earning approximately US $10 per day as the primary source of income for the family. They live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

This is her first loan from Kiva’s partner, CREDIT. She says that a motorbike will enable her family to cut back on public transportation expenses.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Bernie Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Bernie Joy T. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old, is married, and is blessed with one infant child. Bernie Joy owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community. and earns 4,000 PHP net monthly. In 2007, Bernie Joy joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Recently, she's obtaining her 7th loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som P., 55, is married with a three-year-old child. He resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with his wife and daughter (pictured). To make a living, he works in the agriculture sector, raising livestock such as pigs and ducks. In addition to raising livestock, P. grows fruit trees. With his two businesses, he is able to generate an income of $2.5 USD per day as the primary source of family income. P. is asking for a loan of $800 USD to purchase pig food and medicine to protect his pigs from disease. This is his first loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy pig food and pig medicine

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito S. is from the village of Zone 4, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 47 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Juanito owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Juanito has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Juanito joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. He is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mrs. Dany Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who live in Veal Thom village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan and Mrs. DaN. C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member will use the loan which they obtain for a different purpose.

For instance, Mrs. DaN. C. owns a groceR. store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceR. goods for her business. Her husband, Mr. S. Samart, owns a small restaurant selling food.

Mrs. DaN. C. is 46 years old and the mother with two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is employed in a casino club.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn R. has been into buying and selling household appliances like television sets, DVD players, electric fans, rice cookers and other electronics in her community for almost three decades now. She is a 52-year-old widow living in Marcela, Pasay City with her two children. Customers order from her and she sells these items to them on an installment plan. She started small a few years back, but she’s now getting a lot of orders. She also attends to her small sari-sari (general) store right inside her house. She earns more than 22,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from her businesses. While she enjoys her work, she sometimes gets fed up with customers who don’t pay on time. She also gets tired of hopping from one house to another.

Jocelyn joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. Loans provided by the cooperative have been very helpful in the growth of her business. She is now applying for a new loan of 31,000 PHP as additional capital for her business. Jocelyn wishes to soon establish her own stall where she can sell her items and included in her dreams is a grocery store.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. It is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her electronics sales business

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Hin C. is 28 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a divorced mother and has a young child. Hin C. earns a living by sewing clothes at a garment factory, for which she receives a salary of $100 USD per month. She currently lives with her mother, who is aged 61 and a professional tailor. To earn more income in order to help cover the family’s living expenses, Hin C. has decided to request a loan in order to purchase both used and new clothes in bulk to sell.

Note: At the time of the photograph, Hin C. was busy working so her mother is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase both used and new clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom S. is the group leader of four persons who are all in Veal Thom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sarom S. is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it S. she is asking for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Chuon Daravong, is working in government and he makes a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Sarom S. is 35 years-old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school and the other is too young to work or study because this child is only four years-old.

loans.use: To buy piglets.

Rita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI

In 2004, Anita joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Recently, she's obtaining her 4th loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her rice production. loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha R. is 25 years old and lives in the village of Barangay Marobbob Amulung, Cagayan. She is married to Jomar, 27, who manages their farming business in the village. They are blessed with two children: Judith, 5, who attends kindergarten, and Janice, 3.

Editha operates an electronic cellphone load business in her village. In this way, she is able to help her husband earn income for the family. Editha is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP as additional working capital to maintain her business. Moreover, she wants more load to sell so that she can strengthen her business and increase her income. Editha is hoping to enjoy the lending program because it will be a great contribution towards the success of her business.

Editha‘s dreams are to have a comfortable house for her family and for her children to finish their education in order to have a better life.

loans.use: As additional capital to maintain her business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz F. is 69 years old and lives with her husband Felix, 72, in Malibay, Pasay City. All eight of their children are now working.

Beatriz has been buying and selling ready-made curtains for walls, windows, and doors for eight years. She also has cuts and designs for bus and truck windows. She earns at least 12,000 PHP net income per month. She uses her profits to augment her husband’s income, and has also been able to renovate their old house.

Beatriz has been with Kiva partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, since 2001. She is now in need of a new loan of 15,000 PHP as additional capital for her curtain business.

About CCT
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more curtains of various designs

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani A. is from the village of Zone 2, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Lani owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Lani has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lani joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lani has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan T. is 41 years of age and is a married woman. Her husband works as a fisherman, and he appears in the photo. This couple has been married for years and they have two teenage children who work sewing clothes for industry.

In order to support the needs of her family, Chan T. sells a small grocery inventory out of her home. She has been in this business for three years and is earning approximately $2.50 per day.

Chan T. finds it hard traveling to work or anywhere else because she doesn't own a vehicle. She is therefore applying for a loan to buy a used motorbike for her family's riding needs.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for her family's riding needs

loans.name: Mrs. Sareth Khein Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan consists of seventeen people and they all live in Veal Thom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sareth K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fish seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she is asking for a loan to buy more fish to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Prak Ny, is a ferry driver who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sareth K. is 38 years-old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a blacksmith while another one is a laborer. The third one is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mr. Seng P. and Mr. Okyday C. did not come to take a loan but their wives did, so they are present in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Mrs. Fely L. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, is married, and is blessed with two school-aged children.

Fely owns and operates a business selling of variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than five years earning 5,000 PHP net monthly.

In 2008, Fely joined PMPC to access its programs and services.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Zucima

texts.en:
Zucima A. is from the village of Orang Cabgan,Tambulig, Zamboanga DelSur. She is 51 years old. Zucima is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Zucima owns and operates a venture business  in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Zucima has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Zucima joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Zucima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fish to raise and sell in the future. Zucima is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Zucima from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza S. is 22 years old and happily married to Joaquin S., a local farmer in their village. They are blessed with only one daughter, named Jessabel, who is 3 years old.

She owns a small general store in her home that is open from 6:00 am to 8:30 pm. To set up her store, she needs a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase commodities to meet the needs of her customers. She plans to purchase soft drinks and canned goods.

She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request because it will be of great help to her business, and because through the additional commodities her income will also increase, which will become very beneficial for the education of her child.

loans.use: To buy additional commodities to sell

loans.name: Everly

texts.en:
Everly T. is from the town of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 54 years old and a widow with one school-aged child. To make a living, Everly owns and operates a business selling personal home products, ready-to-wear items and drinks to local community members.

In 2009, Everly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Everly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to sustain her business. Everly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married to her loving husband Elmer M., and their marriage was blessed with two children, Jun- jun, who is 32 years old and a company driver, and Jason, who is 24 and a factory worker in South Korea. Their house is along the highway, located in Ramona, Angadanan, Isabela.

Editha has been operating a general store for almost thirty years now. Her daily net income is about $2.30 a day. She is also a gasoline retailer. She decided to ask again for a loan amounting to Php 13,000, because she wants to purchase more commodities to sell. She would also like to expand her business for a better income, and to have a bountiful life.

loans.use: To purchase more commodities to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel D. is from the village of Zone 2, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 36 years old. Samuel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Samuel owns and operates a business venture, buying and selling gold dust in the local community. He engages in gold mining in the traditional way. Samuel has been involved in his business for over five years and earns approximately $107 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Samuel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Samuel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Samuel is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This will be his 4th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand his product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Mrs. Corazon Q. is from the village of Napisik, Sulipat, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, is married, and is blessed with only one school-aged child. Corazon owns and operates a business selling of variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns 5,000 PHP monthly. Recently, Corazon is obtaining her 6th loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mrs. Shina Rath Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of thirteen people and they all live in Veal Thom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Shina R. is the village bank president  selected by the members. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she is asking for a loan to buy more grocery products to re-sell. She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy more fishnets for her husband, Mr. Sam Sarin. Mrs. Shina R. is 46 years-old and the mother of three children.  Two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Mouy Teang L. did not come to take a loan but her husband did so he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To purchase groceries.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en: Mrs. Gaudiosa P. is from the village of Libertad, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, is married and is blessed with three adult children. Gaudiosa owns and operates a banana vending business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than twenty years earning 3,000 PHP net monthly. In 2005, Gaudiosa joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 2nd loan in the amount of 3,500 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her banana vending. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her banana-vending business

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mr. Long T. is age 33, a married man and a father. To help feed his family, Long T. owns an old motorbike which he uses to pick up merchandise for fees. He operates his service around the markets, and most of his clients are market sellers.

He is married and has two school-aged kids. His wife sells cooking ingredients from home (she is the person in the picture).

As the season of harvesting matured rice approaches, Long T. looks for capital to buy rice, which he will sell when the rice commands the highest price.

loans.use: To buy rice, which he will sell when rice commands the highest price

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Mrs. Maria V. is from the village of Dapacan Alto, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old, is married, and is blessed with three school-aged children. In 2008 Maria joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 2nd loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase housing materials. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials

loans.name: Bellie

texts.en:
Bellie A. is from the village of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Bellie owns and operates a business selling snacks, like banana cue (deep-fried bananas with carmelized sugar) and other delicacies, in the local community. Bellie has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $109 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Bellie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bellie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Bellie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
At the age of 49, Delia is running a typical village store. She has been operating her store for almost two years now at Ramona, Angadanan. She wanted to acquire more income, so she needs a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more grocery items to sell. She has a daily net income of $6.75 a day, but her income is insufficient to maintain her business. She’s hoping to produce more income to support the education of her children.

Delia is married to Romeo M., who works as a carpenter in their village. The couple has been blessed with five children, three of whom are already married. The others are still single and presently studying. Their house is in front of their village rest house. She hopes that some generous lenders will grant her loan, for continuous productivity.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Shiphat Chea  Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of ten people located in Khmot village in Kandal province.  All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Shiphat C. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice.  Aside from this plantation, she is a teacher and makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Shiphat C. is 60 years-old and a widow with two children who are employed in a garment factory. Although they try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support the family and they cannot build a kitchen. In order to build the kitchen, Mrs. Shiphat C. is asking for a loan.

loans.use: To build a kitchen.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
This is Lucila M., 63 years old.  Although already a senior citizen, her eyes are still sharp enough that she can still use her sewing machine and make a living from it.  She lives with her husband Romeo, age 60, a family driver in Maricaban, Pasay City.  All their four children are now working.

Lucila has been sewing dresses for all types of people for twenty years now.  She specializes in school uniforms.  Just recently, she found time to prepare sandwiches and sell them to her clients.  She found out that she could earn additional income from it, so she seriously attended to her new business along with her first love – dressmaking.  

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2002.  Now on her 10th loan cycle, Lucila applied for a 15,000 PHP loan so she can purchase and store different kinds of sandwich spread for her new business.   

Lucila says she couldn’t ask for more, because she has already seen the fruits of her labor – all her children have finished schooling and are now working.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her new business venture

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 50 years old and a hog-raiser from the village of Marobbob Amulung, Cagayan. She is married to Eduardo, and they have seven children: Ludivina, 28 years old, a college graduate and a domestic helper in Hong Kong; Natalia, 27 years old, a high school graduate and a farmer; Joey, 25 years old, at high school level and also a farmer; Evangeline, a 23-year-old high school graduate; Marilyn, a 21-year-old high school graduate; Nimfa, 18 years old and a college student taking up Hotel and Restaurant Management; and Shelo, 18 years old and a college student taking up Criminology. 

Josefina used to engage in a retail business. However, due to lack of capital, it did not survive, so she was forced to close it because she couldn't meet the demands of her customers. 

She then decided to venture into the hog-raising business which is located in their back yard. With the small capital from her store, she purchased a few hogs. She hopes to increase her number of hogs but she needs more capital. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will give her the chance to make her business productive by lending her 10,000 PHP. This will be of great help in making her business profitable.

loans.use: To buy more hogs for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum T. currently operates a small basket-weaving business from home. Chum T. makes and sells her finished baskets to buyers who order directly from her house. She also saves up 20 sets of baskets before selling outside. To meet the needs of the family a little more, her husband takes time to provide a taxi service when he is free from weaving baskets. 

This couple lives with two kids who go to school or work. Chum T. hopes to invest in becoming a grocery seller and is taking out her loan to buy various grocery items to begin selling. This will provide her with an extra income source.

loans.use: To buy various grocery items to begin selling

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 39, has operated a junk shop business for almost seven years. She buys junk materials in different places and sells it in her village. From this she earns a weekly net income of Php 300. She has also managed a welding and vulcanizing (tire repair) shop for almost a year.

But due to an inadequate budget, Mary Ann plans to apply for a loan of Php 13,000 as additional capital to purchase more junk. She is hoping earnestly that her requested loan will be granted.

Mary Ann wants to expand her business in order to produce more income for the education of her son. She is married to Kennedy A. and they are blessed with two children: Kenny Mar, 20, a farmer, and Kennedy Jr., 15, a first-year college student.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her junk shop

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo, de 51 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a su esposa, a quien desea dar una buena vida.

Él se dedica es la panadería, su labor comienza muy temprano, aproximadamente a las 4:30 de la mañana ya está en pie y listo para amasar y hacer los panes que disfruta todo su barrio. 
Adolfo es un panadero muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeño aprendió este oficio de su padre.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacer los panes y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 30 años en este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse todos los días temprano, ya que para él no existen fines de semana, ni feriados. 
Para más adelante, anhela poner una tienda donde pueda vender el mismo los panes que hornea.

Este es el primer préstamo de Adolfo con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que está dispuesto a ahorrar día a día para poder pagarlo. Además es muy responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará nuevas bandejas y estantes para los panes, además hará arreglar su horno.
texts.en:
Adolfo, 51, is a hard-working man who lives in his relatives' house with his wife, for whom he wants to provide a good life. He is a baker. His workday begins very early in the morning, at about 4:30am, when he gets up to start kneading the dough and making the bread which everyone in the neighborhood enjoys. Adolfo is a very skilled baker because he learned the craft as a little boy from his father. What he most likes about the job is baking bread which he does with great care. He has had this occupation for 30 years and he considers the most difficult part having to get up so early in the morning every day since for him there is no such thing as weekends or holidays. For later in the future, he would like to set up a store to sell the bread that he himself bakes. This is his first loan with MFP and he doesn't want to fail to repay it for lack of money so he is willing to save day by day to repay it. Besides, he is very responsible and respectful toward the other members. With the one-thousand soles requested he will buy new baking sheets and stands for his bread and he will also get his oven repaired.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita B. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 43 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Mercedita owns and operates a furniture-making business, making and selling bamboo household furniture to local businesses and community members. She makes 5,000 PHP a month from her business. In 2009, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to sustain her business. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mrs. Pao Pech Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people who all live in Khmot village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Pao P. is the village bank president as selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this farming, she is pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food. Her husband, Mr. Maen Phal, is working in a commune. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy more piglets.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, de 27 años, es una mujer muy empeñosa en lo que realiza, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su puesto de ventas está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Se dedica a la venta de tejidos artesanales, los cuales ella misma confecciona en su taller, es por eso que los modelos que vende son únicos y sus clientes no los pueden encontrar en otro lugar.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los fardos de tejidos artesanales desde su taller hasta su puesto de venta. 
Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda más grande, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus prendas.

Este es el primer préstamo de Cecilia con MFP, espera ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y siempre participa en todas las reuniones. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar más tejidos artesanales y así incrementar su stock.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 27, is a very determined woman in everything she does. She lives in a relatives' home and what she most desires is to improve her quality of life. She has a sales stall in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She sells artisanal weavings which she makes herself in her workshop. This is why her items are unique and her customers can't find them anywhere else. What she likes most about her work is being able to chat with her fellow merchants. She has had this occupation for 7 years and believes that the most difficult part of it is moving the bundles of woven goods from her workshop to her sales stand. Her future plans are to have a larger store where she can sell her wares more comfortably. This is Cecilia's first loan with MFP. She expects to make her repayments on time. She is a very active member of her communal bank and always participates in all the meetings. With the one-thousand sol loan requested she will buy more wool to weave her articles and increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a esposo (Victoriano) de 75 años y sus 5 hijos: Ruth de 20, Reyna de 16, Servando de 13, Marco de 10 y Sandro de 7 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Su negocio está ubicado en la explanada “Laguna Temporal” (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), ella vende tejidos artesanales y los modelos que tiene son muy novedosos porque ella misma los teje.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y mientras más lo hace mejor se siente, además que de esta forma puede pagar los estudios de sus menores hijos. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus artesanías hasta su puesto de venta, ya que vive muy lejos de ahí. Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad sus prendas.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Felicitas con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que le ayudará a progresar. Con los seiscientos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que produce.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 45, is a hard-working, determined woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Victoriano, 75 and their 5 children: Ruth, 20, Reyna, 16, Servando, 13, Marco 10, and Sandro, 7, who are the motivating force for all her efforts. Her place of business is in the "Laguna Temporal" esplanade (site of Juliaca's fairs). She sells artisanal weavings and her designs are very unique because she herself weaves them. What she most likes about her work is the weaving and the more she does it the better she feels. Besides, this is a way for her to earn money to pay for her childrens' schooling. She has had this occupation for 3 years and considers the most difficult part of it is having to carry her wares to her sales stall because she lives far away. Her future plans are to save enough money to set up a shop where she can sell her wares more peacefully. This is Felicitas' third loan with MFP and she is very punctual with her payments because she does not want to cause her communal bank any inconveniences; she is very comfortable in it and knows that it will help her to get ahead. With the 600 soles requested she will buy more wool to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Fresita

texts.en:
Fresita has managed a typical retail store for almost ten years in the village of Ramona, Angadanan, Isabela. Her daily net income is Php 300. Aside from that she also raises some hogs for additional income.

Due to a lack of capital, Fresita is motivated to obtain a loan of Php 20,000 from Kiva lenders, to have additional working capital for her business and to have a business expansion. She hopes that lenders will grant her loan as soon as possible to provide her with financial assistance.

At the age of 46, Fresita is still single and has no plans for settling down. According to her she feels contented in what she has right now.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her retail store

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en: Rosalita T., 39 years old, like most women entrepreneurs in the Philippines, earns a lot from buying and selling cosmetics items and apparel from prominent direct-selling companies like Avon, Sundance, Natasha, Marikina Shoe Exchange, etc. This is a tried and tested source of income for housewives. Rosalita’s family lives in Maricaban, Pasay City. Her husband Reynaldo, also 39, is an architectural designer. They have two children: one in college and the other in high school. Rosalita virtually became both father and mother to her children for thirteen years already because her husband works overseas. Rosalita enjoys going to her friends on a house-to-house basis to sell her items. She earns P16,000 a month and even more during holiday seasons. From her profits, which she saves, she was able to purchase a piece of land in the nearby province. Rosalita has been with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2002. The loans provided by the cooperative helped her to pay for cosmetic items from the dealers in cash (when she can pay them on a consignment basis) so she could obtain large discounts and rebates which she also infuses back to her business. Currently, she is applying for a P35,000 loan from CCT to obtain more cosmetics items from her dealer in anticipation of the upcoming Christmas season. Rosalita wishes her husband would stay with them for good and find work here in the Philippines. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics items

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia, de 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.

El trabajo al que se dedica es la elaboración de “empanadas”, desde muy temprano por la mañana trabaja amasando y horneando sus deliciosas bocadillos, para luego distribuirlos a los distintos puestos y tiendas donde tiene contrato. Sus empanadas son muy solicitadas por las personas, es por eso que cada vez tiene más pedidos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que le brinda, ya que después de hacer las empanadas aprovecha para realizar otras actividades que le den buenos ingresos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano por las mañanas, ya que esto la cansa mucho. 
Para el futuro, espera poner una tienda donde pueda vender ella misma sus deliciosas empanadas.

Este es el primer préstamo de Flavia con MFP, está muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito y sabe que tiene que invertir el dinero en su negocio para que sea más productivo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa. Los mil soles solicitados los invertirá en comprar más harina para poder producir una mayor cantidad de empanadas.
texts.en:
Flavia is 41 years old. She is a cheerful and hardworking woman who lives in her own home. What she wants most is to succeed in life.

Flavia makes empandas. She begins very early in the morning kneading the dough and baking these delicious snacks. Later she distributes them to different vending posts and stores that have a contract with her. Her empanadas are highly sought after by people, which explains why she receives many orders.

What Flavia enjoys most about her work is the freedom it provides. After she finishes making empanadas, she takes advantage of the time to pursue other activities to earn more income. She has been in the food business for 10 years and says the hardest part is getting up early since she gets tired often. In the future, she hopes to open a store where she can sell her empanadas directly.

This is Flavia’s first loan with MFP. She is very happy to have this opportunity and knows she has to invest the money into her business in order to be more productive. Flavia is a very active member of her Communal Bank. She will use the money to buy more flour so that she can produce a large quantity of empanadas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan S. is a 26-year-old farmer and mother. She is blessed with a lovely son. Her husband, Mai Sophal, is 28 and works in the farming business. Chan S. inherited from her grandmother the farmland where she and her husband grow different kinds of crops.

This family’s living conditions are not so good because a ladder of their existing house is too old and has broken. Because of this problem, Chan S. is looking for a loan in order to repair an old ladder of her house.

loans.use: Tto repair an old ladder of her house

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Mrs. Maria S. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old, is married, and is blessed with five adult children. Maria owns and operates a specialized retail store selling dried goods and grocery items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than seven years, earning Php 6,000 monthly net income. In 2000, Maria joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 12th loan in the amount of Php 50,000 which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
